[{'created': '2013-09-09 14:53:26.000000000', 'message': 'Augment instead of override extra ML2 options.

The existing ML2 code overwrote extra options set in localrc with
defualt values in some cases. This fixes it so it no longer does
that and instead adds to rather than overrides those values.

Fixes bug 1222854

Change-Id: Iafdaad7d4253f1b61e8a214c50adaf7599a641f2
'}]
commit_message:
Augment instead of override extra ML2 options.

The existing ML2 code overwrote extra options set in localrc with
defualt values in some cases. This fixes it so it no longer does
that and instead adds to rather than overrides those values.

Fixes bug 1222854

Change-Id: Iafdaad7d4253f1b61e8a214c50adaf7599a641f2

[{'created': '2013-09-06 21:00:31.000000000', 'message': 'Default to linuxbridge and openvswitch drivers for ML2.

Since the addition of ML2 port-binding, the linuxbridge and openvswitch
drivers are not required to be loaded when running with ML2. This small
patch adds this to devstack.

Fixes bug 1220743

Change-Id: I97c5f4e0e4af59766e0084ed3b2dea2843cb33bf
'}, {'created': '2013-09-06 21:06:30.000000000', 'message': 'Default to linuxbridge and openvswitch drivers for ML2.

Since the addition of ML2 port-binding, the linuxbridge and openvswitch
drivers are required to be loaded when running with ML2. This small
patch adds their loading into ML2 into devstack.

Fixes bug 1220743

Change-Id: I97c5f4e0e4af59766e0084ed3b2dea2843cb33bf

commit_message:
Default to linuxbridge and openvswitch drivers for ML2.

Since the addition of ML2 port-binding, the linuxbridge and openvswitch
drivers are required to be loaded when running with ML2. This small
patch adds their loading into ML2 into devstack.

Fixes bug 1220743

Change-Id: I97c5f4e0e4af59766e0084ed3b2dea2843cb33bf

commit_message:
Swift: configure Ceilometer when it is enabled

This allows the storage.objects.{incoming,outgoing}.bytes measurements to be
easily used.

Closes-Bug: #1221097
Change-Id: If988a85930d7df1e043997763c3b5ebd720d6d86

commit_message:
config.generator: allow extra modules importing

In Ceilometer we'd like to include the config values from
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token in our default configuration
sample. This patch adds the ability to do so via an environment
variable.

Partial-Bug: #1177443

Change-Id: Ic194219ca7877a9046852a4f20ebc0a4037a970d

Current test_stamp_pattern.py is the following:

 18 import time
 19
 20 from cinderclient import exceptions as cinder_exceptions
 21 import testtools
 22
 23 from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_name
 [..]

I guess this patch should change the above lines to:

 18 import testtools
 19 import time
 20
 21 from cinderclient import exceptions as cinder_exceptions
 22
 23 from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_name
 [..]"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-09-10 01:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

No, that file has the grouping correct. If you look at the hacking guide imports should be split in 3 groups in this order:

Stdlib imports

3rd party imports

project imports

testtools is a 3rd party import not part of the python standard library.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-09-10 01:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Fix import grouping in scenario tests

This commit just fixes the grouping for imports in 2 scenario
test files. Previously they were incorrectly grouping the imports.

Change-Id: I27e37ce03299e878012cbc04f5224ed2681a2df7

primitive before casting the request. This makes requests containing non
primitive types to fail. For example:

cinder create --metadata=Type=test --source-volid $VOLID 1

commit_message:
Call to_primitive on volumes.rpcapi.create_volume

cinder.volume.rpcapi.create_volume does not convert the request_spec to
primitive before casting the request. This makes requests containing non
primitive types to fail. For example:

cinder create --metadata=Type=test --source-volid $VOLID 1

This will create a new volume and call create_volume on volume.rpcapi.
This could will fail because VolumeMetadata won't be serialized
correctly when calling cast. This, however, is not True when
--source-volid is called because in such case,
scheduler.rpcpai.create_volume will be called, which converts
request_spec to primitive correctly.

This issue exists in Grizzly and was accidentally fixed in Havana as part
of the taskflow blueprint.

Change-Id: I096d815254c9782390fba05ea9cd9af925635402
Closes-Bug: #1213964

commit_message:
Call to_primitive on volumes.rpcapi.create_volume

cinder.volume.rpcapi.create_volume does not convert the request_spec to
primitive before casting the request. This makes requests containing non
primitive types to fail. For example:

cinder create --metadata=Type=test --source-volid $VOLID 1

This will create a new database record and call create_volume on
volume.rpcapi.  This will fail because VolumeMetadata won't be
serialized correctly when calling cast. This, however, is not True when
--source-volid is not passed because in such case,
scheduler.rpcpai.create_volume will be called, which converts
request_spec to primitive correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1213964
Change-Id: I096d815254c9782390fba05ea9cd9af925635402

commit_message:
Make type guessing for query args more robust

Improve the error handling of the type-guesser for queries
against metadata fields, and add some test coverage for
specific cases that came out of the discussion of the
source of the bug.

Fixes bug #1221736

Change-Id: I27f84aa2538d2a69a3d7b7e93c36813df8d35204

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-10 10:42:19.000000000', 'message': "* Updated puppet recepies.
  Iaacba512063811f753a2db768858b22b73f3b9c7
* Updated documentation
  Id2384b2226a4932963ebc9f6185a9e0cdea869d0
* murano-git-install.sh fix
  lab-binding.rc file now checked and created before any other operations.
  I0475e4adeb8c1c568125dce4b773bcf857b8cc3f
* Support to use branches not merged yet.
  Additional action 'upgrade' added. Now 'update' only fetches changes
  from repo. murano-git-install.sh now can fetch and install from branches
  that were not merged yet. This should simplify testing and developing.
  If10e830d46c8af58a26b242b576beaa66f8bc1b6
* Fixed error with 'no branch' in murano-git-install.
  Log messages updated.
  I6e56c0bbc0c2b1d997969dc03b0e580f7ec24577
* Checkout of target branch added after clone new repo.
  python-muranoclient removed from list of installed components.
  I4afa028e72a1b82bbb81bc92b69ea7c0a62c4d20
* Ability to checkout ref branch added.
  Iab9a88621283a23063a4c3c558ee3fb31a29514c
* murano-git-install updated
  Additional packages added. Firewall disables. SELinux disabled
  If9449174eaecc3d4736a3bb13ef4420b01256659
* Murano configuration parameters.
  'log_file' and 'auth_url' configuration parameters are updated
  during install
  I3af022db21af8a19de6fefed1d2daaeebd558a4c
* SSL Support added to murano-git-install script.
  Addresses blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/ssl
  Ib9eb1b8727416a7d67a51277b6493c9e58f7c3bd
* Avoiding error message '[: too many arguments'
  I0253723078f5c3e77debfd8a8138559878544959
* Test expression fixed.
  Using test statement [...] was wrong for this type of check.
  Fixes: MRN-903
  Ie6640189206084c89f665478d93ef2444afcfd5b
* Update script for building documentation
  Now documentation built not from source checkouted by Jenkins, but
  checked out explicitly from script. Also we checking out, building
  and publishing several versions at once. No landing page now
  exists.
  Ifbb6d989632ad2277bc1194bd9b440597c916851
* Folder for Murano Getting Started created.
  README updated, Files to start Vagrant box added, devstack's files
  added, permissions on local.sh changed, devstack's files updated.
  I07b2562545e891490bdc6e2d41a804aad8f3ba7f
* Fixed compatibility with Sh
  I077d59f2a864ee8ccace72c35019be17680b8267
* Added feature to build master
  Ib02ddf2a4c5eefb851a1ce12ce515ef4b813bbc1
* Renamed murano-manual developers-guide
  I55332c02533c42ce0ece8d89867180daca48b781
* Three occurences of 'bad' character replaced.
  Fixes: MRN-947
  I2f14b97232f0ad772a339cd7d0ebf25e831a76cf
* Resolved issues with different guide names for different vers
  If487a82bd1d68a13577b3c640117f6c737f48885
* Correct pip version now installing by murano-git-install.
  Bug #1221256
  I837ba3af097f7f59123abdd99d9dc7029568ce4d
* Fixed list of guides for v0.2
  I62240939c742cfc18527b5e79ef578a8bee7224a
* Default branch name fixed.
  Iaac43376f9e3514fe924920035a5a779a303ff11

Change-Id: I7bb689f563f6b9806ff1d8dfd4b2161201820798

commit_message:
Cherry-pick all changes from release 0.2.

* Updated puppet recepies.
  Iaacba512063811f753a2db768858b22b73f3b9c7
* Updated documentation
  Id2384b2226a4932963ebc9f6185a9e0cdea869d0
* murano-git-install.sh fix
  lab-binding.rc file now checked and created before any other operations.
  I0475e4adeb8c1c568125dce4b773bcf857b8cc3f
* Support to use branches not merged yet.
  Additional action 'upgrade' added. Now 'update' only fetches changes
  from repo. murano-git-install.sh now can fetch and install from branches
  that were not merged yet. This should simplify testing and developing.
  If10e830d46c8af58a26b242b576beaa66f8bc1b6
* Fixed error with 'no branch' in murano-git-install.
  Log messages updated.
  I6e56c0bbc0c2b1d997969dc03b0e580f7ec24577
* Checkout of target branch added after clone new repo.
  python-muranoclient removed from list of installed components.
  I4afa028e72a1b82bbb81bc92b69ea7c0a62c4d20
* Ability to checkout ref branch added.
  Iab9a88621283a23063a4c3c558ee3fb31a29514c
* murano-git-install updated
  Additional packages added. Firewall disables. SELinux disabled
  If9449174eaecc3d4736a3bb13ef4420b01256659
* Murano configuration parameters.
  'log_file' and 'auth_url' configuration parameters are updated
  during install
  I3af022db21af8a19de6fefed1d2daaeebd558a4c
* SSL Support added to murano-git-install script.
  Addresses blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/ssl
  Ib9eb1b8727416a7d67a51277b6493c9e58f7c3bd
* Avoiding error message '[: too many arguments'
  I0253723078f5c3e77debfd8a8138559878544959
* Test expression fixed.
  Using test statement [...] was wrong for this type of check.
  Fixes: MRN-903
  Ie6640189206084c89f665478d93ef2444afcfd5b
* Update script for building documentation
  Now documentation built not from source checkouted by Jenkins, but
  checked out explicitly from script. Also we checking out, building
  and publishing several versions at once. No landing page now
  exists.
  Ifbb6d989632ad2277bc1194bd9b440597c916851
* Folder for Murano Getting Started created.
  README updated, Files to start Vagrant box added, devstack's files
  added, permissions on local.sh changed, devstack's files updated.
  I07b2562545e891490bdc6e2d41a804aad8f3ba7f
* Fixed compatibility with Sh
  I077d59f2a864ee8ccace72c35019be17680b8267
* Added feature to build master
  Ib02ddf2a4c5eefb851a1ce12ce515ef4b813bbc1
* Renamed murano-manual developers-guide
  I55332c02533c42ce0ece8d89867180daca48b781
* Three occurences of 'bad' character replaced.
  Fixes: MRN-947
  I2f14b97232f0ad772a339cd7d0ebf25e831a76cf
* Resolved issues with different guide names for different vers
  If487a82bd1d68a13577b3c640117f6c737f48885
* Correct pip version now installing by murano-git-install.
  Bug #1221256
  I837ba3af097f7f59123abdd99d9dc7029568ce4d
* Fixed list of guides for v0.2
  I62240939c742cfc18527b5e79ef578a8bee7224a
* Default branch name fixed.
  Iaac43376f9e3514fe924920035a5a779a303ff11

Also Change default install branch to master.

Change-Id: I7bb689f563f6b9806ff1d8dfd4b2161201820798

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-29 12:19:41.000000000', 'message': 'Addresses the latest resource metadata not being returned in the MongoDB, SQLAlchemy, and HBase drivers. The DB2 driver appears to be lacking support for grouping on the meter collection, so that was written up for someone more familiar with the DB2 NoSQL work to address, as advised. A schema change was required for HBase, because it was overwriting historical metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1208547
Related-Bug: #1201701
Implements: duplicate resource_metadata to meter table
Change-Id: Ib09e21cbc7bbd45a6ecc321403e9947df837e14b

commit_message:
Fix to return latest resource metadata

Addresses the latest resource metadata not being returned in
the MongoDB, SQLAlchemy, DB2, and HBase drivers. A schema
change was required for HBase, because it was overwriting
historical metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1208547
Related-Bug: #1201701
Implements: blueprint hbase-meter-table-enhancement
Change-Id: Ib09e21cbc7bbd45a6ecc321403e9947df837e14b

This reverts commit 1e90eb66ae999201a0b3d2e7409734c3e2f452d7 that
introduces a regression affecting baremetal, see bug 1221620.

In short it assumes a 1-to-1 mapping between service and compute node
entries which does not hold true.

Closes-Bug: #1221620
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Safe db.api.compute_node_get_all() performance improvement"

This reverts commit 1e90eb66ae999201a0b3d2e7409734c3e2f452d7 that
introduces a regression affecting baremetal, see bug 1221620.

In short it assumes a 1-to-1 mapping between service and compute node
entries which does not hold true.

Change-Id: I8f54bd21cd02e14dad2d2e993dcc282c6edf1000
Closes-Bug: #1221620

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 15:49:31.000000000', 'message': "Update rpc/impl_qpid.py from oslo

The current qpid driver cannot serialize objects containing strings
longer than 65535 characters.  This just became a breaking issue when
the message to scheduler_run_instance went over that limit.  The fix has
been commited to oslo, so this just syncs it over to Nova.

The first part of this fix was already ported to Grizzly in
Ib52e9458a9db01e2c8fd2a6d84010733f85980f8 to allow receiving messages
from Havana in the new format. Now we need the rest of it to be able to
send messages bigger than 65K which can happen when fetchingn the
console log from an instance.

This crash in the messaging layer for big messages caused the connection
to be left of the connection pool, which means that after several
crashes the compute node would be left without remaining connectiosn and
completely issolated from the other components. This could be easily
exploited by flooding the console from inside an instance and afterwards
requesting the console-log from the dashboard or the API until the
compute node couldn't answer any more.

Fixes bug: #1215091 (CVE-2013-4261)

Change-Id: I505b648c3d0e1176ec7a3fc7d1646fa5a5232261
"}, {'created': '2013-09-05 08:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Qpid when sending long messages (from oslo)

This is commit 4f97479ad in oslo-incubator

Qpid has a limitation where it cannot serialize a dict containing a
string greater than 65535 characters. This change alters the Qpid
implementation to JSON encode the dict before sending it, but only if
Qpid would fail to serialize it. This maintains as much backward
compatibility as possible, though long messages will still fail if they
are sent to an older receiver.

The first part of this fix was ported to Grizzly in Ib52e9458a to allow
receiving messages from Havana using the new format. Even though this
change will modify the message format, it will only do it when messages
are longer than 65K which would be broken anyway and could cause serious
bugs like the one linked below.

Fixes bug 1215091

Change-Id: I505b648c3d0e1176ec7a3fc7d1646fa5a5232261
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Qpid when sending long messages (from oslo)

This is commit 4f97479ad in oslo-incubator

Qpid has a limitation where it cannot serialize a dict containing a
string greater than 65535 characters. This change alters the Qpid
implementation to JSON encode the dict before sending it, but only if
Qpid would fail to serialize it. This maintains as much backward
compatibility as possible, though long messages will still fail if they
are sent to an older receiver.

The first part of this fix was ported to Grizzly in Ib52e9458a to allow
receiving messages from Havana using the new format. Even though this
change will modify the message format, it will only do it when messages
are longer than 65K which would be broken anyway and could cause serious
bugs like the one linked below.

Fixes bug 1215091

commit_message:
Update ambari admin credentials for scaling

If the cluster is created with alternate credentials for the Ambari
admin use those alternate credentials (rather than the default
'admin/admin' combo) for the scaling operations.

Fixes:  bug #1222542

Change-Id: Ib06906e3f37ec7ee71a04dc1f23cd3698fc33245
(cherry picked from commit d3edcdb996a0188edba44691cb98a0d74a42de4c)

commit_message:
Make nbd reservation thread-safe

Avoid the situation where two local threads choose the same nbd number
for injecting files into the instance. If this happened quickly enough
nova was left with one qemu-nbd hanging and blocking the device forever.

Fixes bug 1207422

Change-Id: I18864b19ebd30669534e45ca7a50e12f61207302
(cherry picked from commit e4ed9e3726b87e4f37138867f752b0588f3626a0)

is scheduled. This is due to the fact, that the mentioned

relationship, which is not true for Nova Baremetal driver.

commit_message:
Fix compute_node_get_all() for Nova Baremetal

Change Ie5ef00c974b810336787e88c78c93c15ca2890d3 introduced
a regression leading to KeyError when a new baremetal node
is scheduled. This is due to the fact, that the mentioned
change assumes, that ComputeNode <--> Service is a 1-1
relationship, which is not true for Nova Baremetal driver.

This patch fixes the tables join in compute_node_get_all()
DB API method to work with 1-M relationship between ComputeNode
and Service models.

Closes-Bug: #1221620

Change-Id: I7c218d06f63cc2bf7d0e358f2f76366601179b0c

Use connection to replace deprecated database_connection

section to replace the deprecated option database_connection
in [DEFAULT].

Fixes bug #1222744

commit_message:
Fix default value for OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE to match documentation.

It should be 'internalURL' and not 'publicURL'. See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html#openstack-endpoint-type

Fixes: bug/1222815
Change-Id: I336bac926cc15bceca9c287ca65f422197f8e615

messages:

- http://logs.openstack.org/30712/1/check/gate-ironic-pep8/123 : FAILURE in 1m 42s

"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-28 14:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (9 inline comments)

Overall very good. I have some comments inline. Of course there are still many #TODO items, as well. Let's try to capture the external requirements (eg, the image fetching and manipulation) so that this patch can work around them.

Also, I would like to see these two files' history preserved, which should be possible as this doesn't appear to be a complete rewrite. I think if you "git rm" the corresponding files in the /ironic/nova/ directory in the same patch, git will recognize the rewrite.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-28 14:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, since this is now running outside of Nova, we don't have the "instance" object, or injected_files, network_info, admin_password, which were passed to the old PXE driver. We need to think about what information we actually need and how Ironic will get it from Nova (what Ironic needs to track, what should be stored in the "control_info" JSON, or what should passed via the API but never stored).'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-28 15:27:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

erm, i meant in the "deploy_info" JSON :)'}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
VMware: Ensure Quantum networking works with VMware drivers

Fixes bug 1202042

A new utility method, is_quantum, is added. This returns True
if Quantum is used by the network_api_class.

(cherry picked from commit 2d7520264a4610068630d7664eeff70fb5e8c681)

Change-Id: Iaf22a43c8e36a7e5825574a082491354e4523619

commit_message:
Fix Qos Specs association corner case

Fix a corner case in associating QoS Specs with Volumt types that was
not handled well: Raise HTTPBadRequest() to client if associate volume
type, which is already associated one qos specs other than specified
qos specs.  Previously such operation will proceed without error which
results overwriting original association.

Also refactor DB API volume_type_qos_specs_get() to return qos specs
in consistent dict format as other qos specs related APIs.

Fix bug: # 1222692

Change-Id: I9db66d1e3a7469620ba542f5387422685a2d828f

commit_message:
VMware: Network fallback in case specified one not found

In the case that opqaue network does not match the bridge ID then
we will fall back on a predefined network (configurable by the admin
via 'integration_bridge' in the 'vmware' section).

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py

Change-Id: Icfe2cb40feada33e5d86e669e1c88f2ce0dd1c5d

commit_message:
Add agent schedule unittest for nicira

Unlike ovs, nec, linuxbridge, ml2 and some other plugins, nicira
seems missing AgentSchedule unittest. Since this plugin supports
dhcp_agent_scheduler, so i think unittest should be added.

Closes-Bug: #1212717
Change-Id: I142e3d3aeabbf79fafaca9fb07a0ae3bcc013f8d

"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-09-08 13:32:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Avishay

I found that is about size, but using %s instead could cover both value 55 and '55', but %d would raise TypeError with '55'.

Although I didn't find any case volume['size'] had been assigned with a string value, but %s could help us ignore this problem. So I chose to use %s. Is this reasonable?"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-09-08 16:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-09-09 07:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

So please explicitly call str() around the variables.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-09-09 07:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think using str() is a little redundant, because when formatting string, %s will call str() on those variables.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-09-09 16:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Avishay

So, what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:01:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think if I would see that line of code, I would assume (wrongly) that those variables are strings. Maybe it's just me..."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-09-09 18:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Avishay, I'm afraid I don't understand why this is an issue for you, we typically format all log messages as strings, why should be do this differently here?  

Also in a number of cases we end up formatting the dict entries as strings intentionally for consistency?

I'll hold off on the +A, but I'm afraid I don't understand your big concern here."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-10 05:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

commit_message:
fix log string in conversion type

By using 'grep -rn "%([a-zA-Z_]*) "', we could find all cases of
'%(variable)'. And we need add an 's' like '%(variable)s'.

Closes-Bug: #1220557
Change-Id: Ib28b7ddc5e5aabe2b82a499d9c242c1982e7f953

commit_message:
Tests use "from keystone import tests"

Use "from keystone import tests" rather than
"from keystone.tests import core as test". This is
consistent with how other packages are imported throughout
Keystone.

Change-Id: Ib0b9ace7468c869f226e8d6c5ab1297563463200

commit_message:
Added Aptira's Current Training Material

Added some images/diagrams.

Fixed whites spaces and unusual characters,
as of short links and repeting doc contents
Sean Roberts has asked me to ignore it for
the moment as it will be done during Training
Docs Sprint on Wed 11 Sept.

Fixed a broken link

    >Most of the XML files are just templates
    >to be filled in later on. This commit is
    >kept lighter just to save the trouble of
    >re-modifying huge chunks of docs, just in
    >case theres an issue with the way its
    >formatted.

bp/training-manuals

Change-Id: I1919e5145322d5f5a49cc08a2bcfa7f65cf19cbe

Add diskimage-creating script, elements for mirrors

* Automatic building Fedora and Ubuntu cloud images with all elements from savanna-extra repository
* Using mirrors for updating images

commit_message:
Allow Hacking 0.7.x or later

Allow newer versions of Hacking as well,
which permits further checks to be used for gating.
Suppress H202 for now to pass tests.

Change-Id: I75ab26df94b5dd8b8b05f4ada2ca6831d8584a75

commit_message:
Do not set failOnValidationError to no

These two guides are the only guides using it, let's remove the setting
to find bugs early.

Change-Id: I826e14975f8954fa80256e5bb41066d1d7b2ecdf

commit_message:
[tempauth] update token if its value changes or expires

In current codes, tempauth token will be updated only when it expires. In
token's lifetime, any changes in tempauth config file doesn't update token,
which means if you update your config file and restart proxy server, the
role in runtime might not change. So a good fix is updating token when
it changes or expires.

fixes bug #1201678

Change-Id: Ieb080e87268e16d0a2e5896431aa41fcedc7a900

commit_message:
Fixes pep8 violation in nova

This patch fixes a simple pep8 violation
that nova complains about.

Fixes Bug #1223046

Change-Id: I6f06939e3729b64fcefc5cdb20da05e7d3172be5

The test uses the same function as everywhere else, I've updated the test to "import gettext_ as _" to make that more clear.

To test this change I performed the following procedure.

1) check out the translations branch from launchpad

    bzr branch lp:~swift-drivers/swift/translations

2) install gettext (the GNU utils)

    brew install gettext && brew link gettext -f

or

    sudo apt-get install gettext

3) compile a .po file to a messages.mo

    msgfmt ./locale/es.po

4) "install" the .mo for the swift domain into your system

    cp messages.mo /usr/share/locale/es/LC_MESSAGES/swift.mo

or

    cp messages.mo `python -c 'import gettext; print gettext._default_localedir + "/es/LC_MESSAGES/swift.mo"'`

^ you might have to create that directory

5) set your preferred locale with LC_ALL

    export LC_ALL=es

6) test

    python -c 'from swift import gettext_ as _; print _("Client disconnected without sending enough data")''}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-13 03:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Remove dupe account_audit when reporting stats

- Remove duplicate account_audit call that happened once an hour when stats
where reported.
- And fixed a flake8 complaint

Change-Id: Ide686c475f8648664e9cffdd696629cf6ba9f75c

Added support for running the tests under PyPy with tox

This is a precursor to having them run under check and gate.

Change-Id: I98692ac2591d488f0c5c6e64b1c176b21254289c

[{'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-09-10 03:16:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm confused as to how this would help, wouldn't this just result in `str(ex)` raising an error here, instead of a few calls down the stack?"}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-09-10 03:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

str(ex) wasn't erroring, logging framework itself was erroring. Anyhow, I think this is fixed in trunk a different way, so abandoning."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-09-10 03:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

See the bug'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-10 03:06:35.000000000', 'message': "Don't log non-str()-able objects.

There is something which has a __str__ method that returns Message
rather than str, which breaks logging. I haven't tracked it down but
as str(Message) is a str, this addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I2195ce8a6163b3c69dc307d6189a47ae082d44e2
Closes-Bug: #1223149
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log non-str()-able objects.

There is something which has a __str__ method that returns Message
rather than str, which breaks logging. I haven't tracked it down but
as str(Message) is a str, this addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I2195ce8a6163b3c69dc307d6189a47ae082d44e2
Closes-Bug: #1223149

NVP plugin and NVP platform 2.2

Fixes bug 1220931

commit_message:
Avoid KeyError 'distributed' exception when using NVP <3.x

This patch fixes an issue found when creating routers with
NVP plugin and NVP platform 2.2

Fixes bug 1220931

Change-Id: Ia7b358b59e48a723c07efec015bb650accaa3322

commit_message:
backport volume snapshot test to tempest/grizzly

the volume snapshot feature was available in grizzly but the test
in tempest was added after the branch; this backports the basic
volume snapshot create/list/delete test

Change-Id: I7530b34fa155b68c04eb097aaa674191afaca05a

commit_message:
Import core.* in keystone.tests

This will allow us to 'from keystone import tests' to import core
test functions. This is consistent with other modules in Keystone.

Change-Id: I8c3044cad85fee37a237264da198465fcb3c0898

commit_message:
Modify User Attributes API - Fix

This fix does not allow empty host strings in the update user call.
Besides, it also enusres that database access is not lost during an update of the host attribute

Change-Id: I57b7733c264d2bcd70dfea95f85aae68553c4dff
Fixes: bug #1214166
Fixes: bug #1214555

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 19:01:06.000000000', 'message': 'Set launch_index to right value

Fix bug 1212648

When boot multiple instances in one request, the launch_index
was not increased.

The fix was increase the launch_index one by one for each instances
in one request.

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/api.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py

Change-Id: I27dde8cfae52853d33277c3d8e0e65c91bc6280b
(cherry picked from commit c8f0a545bfafdc72bae0a43df78ae51835e35232)
'}]
commit_message:
Set launch_index to right value

Fix bug 1212648

When boot multiple instances in one request, the launch_index
was not increased.

The fix was increase the launch_index one by one for each instances
in one request.

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/api.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py

Change-Id: I27dde8cfae52853d33277c3d8e0e65c91bc6280b
(cherry picked from commit c8f0a545bfafdc72bae0a43df78ae51835e35232)

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-09-05 19:27:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hm, now that I look at it more, it seems that this has some ripple effects. In particular, if /srv/node/$device/tmp is a file (not a directory), then currently the replicators will log exceptions. This change would swallow the OSError that ultimately results in that exception, so you'd get silent failures to clean up tmp... but on the other hand, not blowing up there means that the data on the device will get replicated instead of the replicator just failing and moving on to the next device.

However, if a DB replicator (account or container) can't copy stuff (remote db files, specifically) into tmp on a device, it'll fail anyway, and in a harder-to-debug fashion.

So, I think I like patch set 1 better, even though it's got a little structural duplication. Sorry for the waffling."}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-09-05 21:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-09-05 21:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

No problem, I think I even  managed to do the right thing with git.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-09-05 21:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

http://paste.openstack.org/show/45908/'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-09-06 14:10:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The reason it doesn't get coverage on the continue statements has to do with how the optimizer rewrites the JUMP bytecodes. It's actually impossible for coverage to find them :)"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-09-06 14:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Ned Batchelder says:

"""

Sadly, yes: https://bitbucket.org/ned/coveragepy/issue/198/continue-marked-as-not-covered

My ticket against CPython to get a way to turn off the peephole optimizer was marked wontfix: http://bugs.python.org/issue2506 .

"""

Is this something we could get PyPy to do better at with coverage?'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-09-06 14:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

There's nothing PyPy exposes currently to improve the situation, it'd probably be possible to expose a CLI flag to disable JUMP-optimizations."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-09-06 20:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Perform fewer stat calls when doing auditing of objects

Each `isdir` or `exists` call performs a stat, but that info is already
available from the exception if it doesn't exist in `listdir`.

Change-Id: I831494e3dbc8fda62ab29431471566bdb8dc6d27

commit_message:
Provide a method for retrieving on-disk metadata

We hide the internal dictionary for the metadata providing a method to
retrieve it to abstract away the implementation details of how
DiskFile object provides and maintains that metadata.

This is in anticipation of the DiskFile API refactoring.

Change-Id: I1c0dc01a4680bd435512405e2d31fba24421720a
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2013-09-09 03:27:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

i'd rather check the length is equal instead just check the existence"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-09-09 04:20:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure that this change improves the clarity of what is being asserted. As ZhiQiang suggested, based on the bug report, I expected a one line fix.

  self.assertTrue(len(users) > 0)

or just

  self.assertTrue(users)

To be super explicit, I'd suggest ensuring that the expected set of user ID's equals the set of user ID's returned by the backend.

  user_ids = set(user['id'] for user in users)
  self.assertEqual(expected_user_ids, user_ids)"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-09-09 07:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-09-09 07:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So good comments by both, and I think in fact the solution is to use both.  The set() idea with assertEqual is nice...but of course would mask duplicates, so checking length will catch that.

OK, I know this is all quite pedantic and we know the backend works for this API, but we do these kind of tests in a few places and I found the bug when I copied the original code to use in a different test.  So it is nice to have an agreed way of checking the (quite common) case of getting a list of IDs back from an API call and wanting to test it matches the list we are expecting.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 08:04:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Fix incorrect test for list_users

The current test would not fail if incorrect data was returned by
the driver.  The list_roles test also has the same issue.

Fixes bug 1222574

Change-Id: Icc5e76e9453436ac208c5f262d0dd4082b700d02

I like the explanation in the commit and the test.  It's interesting how it sorta jiggles itself out after awhile.  This seems to work fine on all the rings I'm able to test... but...

Since this is specifically solving a problem where you've run out of tiers that don't already have this replica... shouldn't it go ahead and get behind that optimization guard where you can just pick the first candidate_tier who's other_replicas' is 0?"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-08-14 18:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-14 20:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

K, much clearer, thanks.  I retract my earlier concern.

The unbalance will happen anytime you have tiers with different capacity.  The existing comment (you can only just barely see the bottom half in the diff) describes itself as selecting the "hungriest-drive"  but the existing code obviously does not.  I don't see an obvious way to achieve the behavior without the sort.

Unfortunately, the sort (and lambda) become a dominating force in the _reassign_parts method.  In my tests there was a 17-20% increase in the time to rebalance a small ring.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/44158/

On a balanced ring with hundreds of devices pulling a single device and doing a rebalance was also about 16% slower.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/44164/

I generally prefer correct to optimized, and in this case I fall in favor of fixing balance right the first time rather than multiple rebalance/push/rsync cycles.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-09-09 19:32:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Looks good in principal, but was not able to show the unit test exercising that code."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-09-09 20:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hoping for more info, test seems to demonstrate failure and fix on my machine:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/46365/'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-09-09 21:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry guys, this looks fine.

I failed to realize that _initial_balance() also calls _reassign_parts(). I looked at a coverage report from just running that test, indeed, that changed code is covered.

Sorry for missing that, let's ship it without taking another patch set for an updated test."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 21:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

[{'created': '2013-08-13 22:18:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix unbalanced rings after initial creation.

Sometimes you'd make a ring that should have a good balance (~= 1),
but it would come out with a poor balance (>= 90). Rebalancing a
couple times would fix it, but it shouldn't be necessary to do that.

This was due to a bug in the ring builder's rebalance() method where,
when placing a replica for a partition, it would pick *one of* the
tiers with the lowest number of replicas, but the choice was made
without regard to parts_wanted.  Now rebalancing pays attention to the
drives' parts_wanted attributes, so the tier with the emptiest drive
gets the replica.

(Also fixed a typo in a completely unrelated comment.)

Change-Id: I1821f15170f0ed212b0ad7c81b97031540ab4460
"}, {'created': '2013-08-14 19:21:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix unbalanced rings after initial creation.

Sometimes you'd make a ring that should have a good balance (~= 1),
but it would come out with a poor balance (>= 90). Rebalancing a
couple times would fix it, but it shouldn't be necessary to do that.

This was due to a bug in the ring builder's rebalance() method where,
when placing a replica for a partition, it would pick *one of* the
tiers with the lowest number of replicas, but the choice was made
without regard to parts_wanted.  Now rebalancing pays attention to the
drives' parts_wanted attributes, so the tier with the emptiest drive
gets the replica.

(Also fixed a typo in a completely unrelated comment.)

Change-Id: I1821f15170f0ed212b0ad7c81b97031540ab4460
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unbalanced rings after initial creation.

Sometimes you'd make a ring that should have a good balance (~= 1),
but it would come out with a poor balance (>= 90). Rebalancing a
couple times would fix it, but it shouldn't be necessary to do that.

This was due to a bug in the ring builder's rebalance() method where,
when placing a replica for a partition, it would pick *one of* the
tiers with the lowest number of replicas, but the choice was made
without regard to parts_wanted.  Now rebalancing pays attention to the
drives' parts_wanted attributes, so the tier with the emptiest drive
gets the replica.

(Also fixed a typo in a completely unrelated comment.)

Change-Id: I1821f15170f0ed212b0ad7c81b97031540ab4460

maint: remove redundant disk_cachemode validation entry

commit_message:
Move string expansion outside localisation (H702)

String expansion should be done outside localisation call (_()),
otherwise there will never be a matching string found in the
catalogue.

Also enable gating on this Hacking check (H702).

Change-Id: Ie7c89fbfb52629e75d5e68e9afda8bcf50bf4cdd

subject: Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-29 20:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So it looks like H231 is the reported code for a violation (see https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/hacking/core.py#L311), and since it is not in our tox.ini "ignore" line, one might think that a pep8 run would catch this. But at least on my system is does not.

So if somebody uses a "," in an except clause, what mechanism will catch this?'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-08-30 07:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Peter, thats correct, it is an OpenStack Hacking check (H231). You need to install Hacking 0.6 or newer in order to get the check. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44231/ for the 2nd part of this review.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-30 10:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I am all for this kind of clean up.

However, if the various Jenkins jobs still have hacking < 0.6, and one developer has hacking >= 0.6, then can't another developer who commits a "," in an except clause all-of-a-sudden cause another developer's pep8 tests to fail?

That seems like a fairly frustrating situation, no?  If folks don't mind that, I am okay with these changes.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-08-30 20:20:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Peter, yes, that can happen. This is however not a particularly difficult warning for this one developer to resolve then, and it would be a temporary problem anyway. If the followup patch is approved, Jenkins will check all submissions with Hacking 0.6/0.7, and thereby avoid this situation. 

In essence I think we're discussing consistency vs adaptation. In order to stay consistent with everything, you can't change anything. When you adapt changes, things become slightly inconsistent as part of the process."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-30 21:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Okay, that is the missing piece for me, the follow-on commit fixes this.

I won't approve this until the other one is approved so that we can essentially get them together."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-08-30 21:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-08-30 21:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

except x,y: was deprected and is removed in Python 3.x.
Use "except x as y:" instead which works in any Python
version >= 2.6.

Change-Id: I7008c74b807340f3457d3a0c8bd0b83f23169d14

commit_message:
Do not use locals() for string formatting (H501)

Fixes a warning triggered by Hacking 0.7.x or newer. There
is no need to use a positional string formatting here, since
this is not going to be localized.

Change-Id: Ie38d620aecb0b48cd113af45cc9ca0d61f8f8ff1

subject: rename the remotefs config options
messages:
[{'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-09-09 21:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This breaks backward compatibility from Grizzly which used nfs_mount_point_options, nfs_mount_point_base, etc.

But even if it didn't, I'm not convinced we should prefix these with "brick_".  This doesn't make much sense to a user writing a config file.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-09-09 21:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
rename the remotefs config options

This patch renames the config options for
the brick remotefs module so they don't
conflict with nova's already existing options.

Fixes Bug #1223020

Change-Id: I33317a312c6c184783d8b364c51305bbf1e27a41

admin use those alternate credentials (rather than the default
'admin/admin' combo) for the scaling operations.

Change-Id: I2b8a613e2a86083b04450487555d7a93b36f3b8a
(cherry picked from commit d3edcdb996a0188edba44691cb98a0d74a42de4c)

commit_message:
Update ambari admin credentials for scaling

If the cluster is created with alternate credentials for the Ambari
admin use those alternate credentials (rather than the default
'admin/admin' combo) for the scaling operations.

Fixes:  bug #1222542

Change-Id: I2b8a613e2a86083b04450487555d7a93b36f3b8a
(cherry picked from commit d3edcdb996a0188edba44691cb98a0d74a42de4c)

commit_message:
Added API doc for VPNaaS, based on the initial code

Used the data model information from the Wiki page at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/VPNaaS, cleaned up some
of the syntax, invoked the commands with --verbose option,
and collected JSON requests and responses. Spell checked.

bug 1203865

Change-Id: Iae57319a0fab61d4f0a82f2ea168d6a2c841e9ca

Add the pxe.get_pxe.bootfile_name call such that the correct
infromation (i.e. pxelinux.o) is provided back to the driver.py

Change-Id: I393552ae2d45e1ff5bc306fc8717fa4265ac827f
Closes-Bug: #1220904
'}, {'created': '2013-09-05 02:47:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix the bootfile_name method call in baremetal

nova baremetal was supplying a pxelinux config file disk path, but
PXE clients need the binary to bootstrap, which is neither the config
file, nor a filesystem path - it's a path within TFTP server.

As some environments/architectures may have differenet PXE binary,
this needs to be an option.

Change-Id: I393552ae2d45e1ff5bc306fc8717fa4265ac827f
Closes-Bug: #1220904
"}, {'created': '2013-09-07 16:44:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix the bootfile_name method call in baremetal

PXE clients need the binary to bootstrap, which is neither the config

commit_message:
Fix the bootfile_name method call in baremetal

nova baremetal was supplying a pxelinux config file disk path, but
PXE clients need the binary to bootstrap, which is neither the config
file, nor a filesystem path - it's a path within TFTP server.

As some environments/architectures may have different PXE binary,
this needs to be an option.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I393552ae2d45e1ff5bc306fc8717fa4265ac827f
Closes-Bug: #1220904

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-05 18:23:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix PCIDevice ignoring missing DB attributes

Right now, the PCIDevice _from_db_object() method ignores missing
attributes on the DB object by using get(). This prevents the strict
typechecking from doing it's job, and differs from every other object
model currently in the tree. As a result, non-nullable attributes such
as dev_type are string-converted to "None" in the object, which is
definitely not the intent.

This is convention, not something we test for, but it was wrong, and
ended up breaking the next patch which introduces a scenario where this
gets checked in the unit tests more strictly. Thus, the test is in the
next aptch

Change-Id: Id6e1f444ceae13ee9fa1a9518db5a239a1d9fbe3
Closes-bug: 1221360

commit_message:
Fix PCIDevice ignoring missing DB attributes

Right now, the PCIDevice _from_db_object() method ignores missing
attributes on the DB object by using get(). This prevents the strict
typechecking from doing it's job, and differs from every other object
model currently in the tree. As a result, non-nullable attributes such
as dev_type are string-converted to "None" in the object, which is
definitely not the intent.

This is convention, not something we test for, but it was wrong, and
ended up breaking the next patch which introduces a scenario where this
gets checked in the unit tests more strictly. Thus, the test is in the
next aptch

Change-Id: Id6e1f444ceae13ee9fa1a9518db5a239a1d9fbe3
Closes-bug: 1221360

'}, {'account_id': 6804, 'date': '2013-09-06 20:08:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[Nova] FFE Request: Encrypt Cinder volumes
We request that volume encryption [1] be granted an exception to the feature freeze for Havana-3.  Volume encryption [2] provides a usable layer of protection to user data as it is transmitted through a network and when it is stored on disk. The main patch [2] has been under review since the end of May and had received two +2s in mid-August.  Subsequently, support was requested for booting from encrypted volumes and integrating a working key manager [3][4] as a stipulation for acceptance, and both these requests have been satisfied within the past week. The risk of disruption to deployments from this exception is minimal because the volume encryption feature is unused by default.  Note that the corresponding Cinder support for this feature has already been approved, so acceptance into Nova will keep this code from becoming abandoned.   Thank you for your consideration.

The APL Development Team

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/encrypt-cinder-volumes 
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30976/ 
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45103/ 
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45123/'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-09-09 14:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Synchronize the key manager interface with Cinder

This change synchronizes the key manager interface with code that
has been accepted by Cinder. The default key manager (i.e.,
NotImplementedKeyManager) raises NotImplementedError for all
operations. A copy_key method has also been added to the key
manager interface so that keys may be deleted when the objects
that they encrypt (e.g., a volume) are deleted.

Implements blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: Ie9ab9578402e87338b6a4bd413bb9f875d3b3eb6

commit_message:
use '--disable-dhcp' option

The option "--enable_dhcp" for "neutron subnet-create" is not visible
in the command documentation. The visible option is "--disable_dhcp".

Change-Id: Ieeac6bafc7707b114842ba7bbdf5b1310430597d
Closes-Bug: 1221923

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-09 09:04:08.000000000', 'message': 'hacking should conform with OS requirements

hacking did not make any assumption on which version of six is
installed, therefore hacking pulled in an incompatible six version,
making it impossible to run the tests.

fixes bug 1222706

Change-Id: Icd31caa93587614425036fc4c8d3cfd3a83b6b3c
'}]
commit_message:
hacking should conform with OS requirements

hacking did not make any assumption on which version of six is
installed, therefore hacking pulled in an incompatible six version,
making it impossible to run the tests.

fixes bug 1222706

Change-Id: Icd31caa93587614425036fc4c8d3cfd3a83b6b3c

"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-09-09 16:33:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Seems like TempestConfig() is already assigned to 'config' in the BaseTestCase. So why is all this necessary?"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:23:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So I thought that config is set during setUpClass in the base test class. Which means that for skipIf decorators tempestConfig() won't have been run yet. Which is why we have to manually run it during the class init.

We've hit this a couple times in the past. At some point soon I'm going to look into changing our config usage to be global like it's done in the other projects. Then we won't have this issue any more."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 18:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix tempest config usage in test_attach_volume

This commit just reworks the config usage for class level variables
that use config values to avoid making uneccesary calls of
TempestConfig().

Change-Id: I48a5f402c9e7a743d65c54ccc0a1df494554676c

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-09-06 10:46:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

there is no feature freeze per say on devstack, we cut stable some time late in the cycle. I think this is fine to have, but I don't want to merge it until after the tempest changes are merged, because I think we expose users to a race in the gate otherwise, which I'd like to avoid. So +1 but don't approve until the tempest change is in."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-09-06 14:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

for reference we are waiting on this change - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45342/'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-06 15:48:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Curiosity: what happens when this is configured and Nova is running on a one core VM?  I'm guessing we get 4 workers anyway? If you have 1 core this will still create 4 workers.  As for your 1GB RAM vm, if that becomes a problem we can turn this into a knob later on.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-06 17:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Enable multi-threaded nova API servers

Add an additional worker thread for each nova service: compute, ec2 and
metadata.  Any real deployment will be using multiple API server
threads, so lets make devstack test that scenario.  With this patch we
will have four worker threads for each type of API server.

Change-Id: I09f4c6f57e71982b8c7fc92645b3ebec12ff1348

commit_message:
Made apischema a bit less restrictive.

All additionalProperties are now True instead of False
All array minsizes are now 0 instead of 1
Create Instance now has an additional service_type optional property

fixes bug #1215183
fixes bug #1218661
fixes bug #1218662

Change-Id: If5c9344464a730220a588294383bb473e7bc5e7c

commit_message:
Move toward using a backend+connection model

Instead of having a pretty restrictive module
based api for saving logbook objects it is much
more friendly and extensible to move toward a more
ceilometer-influenced engine and connection based
storage backend using stevedore to do the backend
loading instead of a custom registration/fetching
mechanism. This allows us to provide a base object
oriented backend api that can be easily inherited
from to allow for customized & pluggable backend
storage modules.

- Removes the database/session usage from oslo
  incubator, and replaces it with a more modular.
  and more pluggable version based on backend objects
- Removes further usage/dependence on oslo.cfg.
- Resyncs with oslo-incubator after removing oslo
  database+session modules to pickup newest changes.

Implements blueprint eliminate-oslo-cfg
Implements blueprint stevedore-based-backends
Implements blueprint ceilometer-influenced-backends

Change-Id: I73545cd7f6069a87226c07140c1d66d7cc8af63c

commit_message:
Missing pxelinux.0 on RedHat systems

On a RedHat system the syslinux binaries are located in a different
directory.

Change-Id: I3b7a111e82e8845b6222c57fb2cfb725d9bb1dd7

commit_message:
Remove unused _decompress_image_file from powervm operator class

While looking at bug 1214985 I noticed that the _decompress_image_file
method in the BaseOperator class wasn't being used, so this patch simply
cleans that up to avoid future confusion.

Related-Bug: #1214985

Change-Id: Ic6f2010727dcc1dfabc310ffa3bd5ca0b6799537

Can resize ever throw and exception and leave the device mounted?  If so, it needs to be protected.  If not, you can ignore my comment and I'll change to a +1."}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-08-19 16:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

According to the code - no. It can throw on unget_dev(), but that means it would be left broken anyway. The whole mount module is written using trycmd() calls rather than execute() and returns "False" on error.

It's used without protection in class _DiskImage.mount() too.

From what I can see, it's ok without a try block, but I've been wrong before :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-19 18:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 8430, 'date': '2013-08-20 13:56:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I did a re-review and followed the path.  From my reading, resize2fs does in fact do an execute and NOT a trycmd.  execute would not catch command failures.  See:
def resize2fs(image, check_exit_code=False, run_as_root=False):
    utils.execute('e2fsck', '-fp', image,
                  check_exit_code=check_exit_code,
                  run_as_root=run_as_root)
    utils.execute('resize2fs', image,
                  check_exit_code=check_exit_code,
                  run_as_root=run_as_root)"}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-08-20 14:34:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Yes, it's an execute, but in this case it also sets check_exit_code to False. Or does not change it from the default of False to be more precise."}, {'account_id': 8430, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Got it.  Thanks for the explanation.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-08-23 22:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-27 18:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

While the code looks logically correct, a couple of points.

1. Currently we don't mount images when libguestfs is available. By unconditionally mounting into the running kernel we may introduce a security issue. This was one of the reasons
for avoiding such code and using in guest cloud_init based instead.

2. nbd mounting is not generally available or supported.

3. libvirt.driver.finish_migration() should be able to avoid
it's qcow -> raw dance to support resizing. Though again it
would have to fall back to this if the nbd resizing didn't work.

So given the above I'm -1 on this for now"}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-08-28 12:49:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for the comment p-draigbrady

Re points 1, 2: The way I read them is that support for resizing qcow2 images without cloud-init is considered deprecated. Is that really the case? Two such images I know of are the official ubuntu lucid (has cloud-init, but only an old one) and cirros (used in devstack).

I'm just not sure if your -1 was for the whole idea or did you request libguestfs support where available. (doable via virt-resize)

If it's the latter, do you think there's any bad side effect of libguestfs starting to resize partitions that were previously untouched by nbd mounting? Nbd mounts were only expanded in case of ext filesystem, but libguestfs would do much more (also ntfs, btrfs). Seems like a big behaviour change."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-29 02:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

So it would be much better (avoiding the security issue) if virt-resize was used. That would implement this:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/resize-no-raw

Though there was some push back against those given that
newer cloud-init supports this. Also virt-resize does not modify in place which might cause some awkwardness.'}, {'account_id': 2036, 'date': '2013-08-29 11:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Though there was some push back against those given that
> newer cloud-init supports this.

Yes sure. But Ubuntu 10.04 for example contains a version of cloud-init that doesn't do resizing. That image was resized properly by Nova previously but not anymore. So it's a regression, and should be fixed IMHO.

Also, if we don't have this, we're breaking compatibility with AWS. Not sure if that's a big deal, just wanted to mention it."}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-09-03 17:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-09-03 17:17:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@p-draigbrady I addressed your comment about the Raw class, but couldn't really do anything about virt-resize. It simply doesn't work in my environment, so I cannot implement anything using it.

Instead of forcing nbd on everyone, I added a flag (turned on by default, so it brings back the previous resizing behaviour) which can be used to turn off resizing by the compute host. If nbd is not available, the process will continue, but with pretty clear error messages (nbd module not loaded).

I hope that's enough to get this issue fixed. Someone else with more knowledge about libguestfs can do the blueprint you mentioned."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-03 17:38:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- gate-nova-pylint http://logs.openstack.org/60/42160/7/check/gate-nova-pylint/f23a2d9 : SUCCESS in 16m 30s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-09-03 17:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Just a general question before I review.
Did we really support resizing qcow images previously?
If so, when did it break? thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-09-04 15:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-09-04 15:23:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@p-draigbrady I can't pinpoint the moment when it changed, since it's hard to test old versions with new devstack. It's not that openstack ever handled resizing qcow2 before, but in Diablo what happened was that image was downloaded as raw and resized to 10G while it was still in _base. Right now, the base images are not resized, but rather the instance disk files are. (probably started around the time variable root size was introduced with bp disk-configuration-parity)

So previously we never resized qcow2. fetch_to_raw() guaranteed that. The regression started, when nova started changing instance rather than raw base files."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-04 15:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

I suppose I would like to see us use resize_fs_using_block_device=False as the default here for several reasons:

1) Like pbrady mentioned: There are security concerns associated with mounting images. It should be opt in.

2) Not all distros/packages deploy NBD modules by default. As such they may now get ERROR's like this if they use this flag:

2013-09-07 16:22:03.244 25204 ERROR nova.virt.disk.mount.nbd [req-ee662f30-44b4-440b-a451-cda69cef3f95 dd19308862914712b3d27cd3dd0c0704 8ae7a266f33441db947e0b31c054cf3e] nbd module not loaded"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-09-09 18:41:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I would also prefer it to be False by default actually as this usefulness is only for (older) images that don't support resizing themselves"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-09-09 19:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I've submitted change Ifbd687eae46606176ea196888eeffdde08559c01 to change the default"}]

commit_message:
Ensure old style images can be resized

In case an image without, or with an old cloud-init is booted, decide
if it's the file, or the nbd device that needs to be resized. Qcow2
files have to be mounted as nbd before attempting a resize.

Fixes bug 1212734

Change-Id: I29cbd4b334c39936342fa429bcc0b95378cade36

commit_message:
Redirect stderr for git rev-parse

If not in a git directory the git warning messages will be printed.
These warnings shouldn't be shown to users and can make things
confusing.

Change-Id: I6b872a7407141edeed33ac6157022743a2919f6d

``listdir`` already handles the ENOENT and returns an empty list in
that case.

Change-Id: I597d7ffa9979f668a856519062839505d26129f2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't stat the path in ``unlink_older_than``

``listdir`` already handles the ENOENT and returns an empty list in
that case.

Change-Id: I597d7ffa9979f668a856519062839505d26129f2

commit_message:
Setting up ovs agent, check for ovs bridge

When starting ovs agent, and ovs integration bridge
does not exist, agent crashes. Integration bridge, should
be recreated.

Fixes Bug: #1222954
Change-Id: Iba8d324e5d0b7ab0c06014cd02f90b9ff023b921

commit_message:
Update ambari admin credentials for scaling

If the cluster is created with alternate credentials for the Ambari
admin use those alternate credentials (rather than the default
'admin/admin' combo) for the scaling operations.

Fixes:  bug #1222542

Change-Id: Ib06906e3f37ec7ee71a04dc1f23cd3698fc33245

Add SS results support for ceilo/heat.

more results.

commit_message:
Validate enabled_nomask in LDAP tests

This enhances the LDAP backend tests to also validate that enabled_nomask
is returned (or not) as expected to ensure that the behavior isn't broken.

Related-bug: #1220945

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-06 19:08:08.000000000', 'message': 'Do not return enabled_nomask

The Keystone server was returning the enabled_nomask attribute
in the user entry when users were listed or updated and the
server was configured to use the LDAP Identity backend and the
user_enabled_mask configuration option is non-zero.

This change makes it so that the enabled_nomask attribute is
not returned in user entries.

Change-Id: I5fb39a1ad50e37f60e2ba760a0ad203a204769df
Related-bug: #1220945
'}]
commit_message:
Do not return enabled_nomask

The Keystone server was returning the enabled_nomask attribute
in the user entry when users were listed or updated and the
server was configured to use the LDAP Identity backend and the
user_enabled_mask configuration option is non-zero.

This change makes it so that the enabled_nomask attribute is
not returned in user entries.

Change-Id: I5fb39a1ad50e37f60e2ba760a0ad203a204769df
Related-bug: #1220945

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 02:47:01.000000000', 'message': 'Return empty list when listing servers with bad status value

API indicates the status parameter is a string, hence status=BALONEY is a valid
filter that should return zero records since no records match that status. The
return should be an empty list and 200 OK.

Fixes bug 1061712

Change-Id: If796110a18dd75ab5c5d4ba41e9c3b58180341f8
(cherry picked from commit e142d21b47e8895a013c468936e69ba0e7e66041)
'}]
commit_message:
Return empty list when listing servers with bad status value

API indicates the status parameter is a string, hence status=BALONEY is a valid
filter that should return zero records since no records match that status. The
return should be an empty list and 200 OK.

Fixes bug 1061712

Change-Id: If796110a18dd75ab5c5d4ba41e9c3b58180341f8
(cherry picked from commit e142d21b47e8895a013c468936e69ba0e7e66041)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-05 14:08:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failure to emit notification on Instance.save()

The ordering of things in Instance.save() meant that we were
consulting an emptied list of changes to determine if we should
send a notification. This fixes that by maintaining the
calculated list of fields being updated for that decision.

Change-Id: I35ef56963713089e566815f37ed0ee4038694d91
Closes-bug: 1220186
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failure to emit notification on Instance.save()

The ordering of things in Instance.save() meant that we were
consulting an emptied list of changes to determine if we should
send a notification. This fixes that by maintaining the
calculated list of fields being updated for that decision.

Change-Id: I35ef56963713089e566815f37ed0ee4038694d91
Closes-bug: 1220186

following python-ldap docs

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-08-30 13:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm a bit confused here. This test is not 'smoke' and so has never run in the gate. The only reason to start skipping it is that a non-gating tempest run including this test is failing, or that a change is coming in stable/grizzly that will break the test. That would be an unusual action. I think more explanation is needed to disable a test on a stable branch."}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-30 13:59:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

These tests are currently broken when running openstack with quantum. 

I'm trying to fix this from the perspective of a downstream distribution who are also running tempest internally against the full openstack (stable/grizzly with quantum). I understand that these tests not passing do not affect gate jobs, but it does affect us and possibly other downstream projects.

I don't understand why you're implying that tempest should have a special status on the stable branch. IMHO it should have all tests pass against the respective stable branch of the other openstack components which it currently does not."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-08-30 14:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I agree with you. I was simply trying to ask if it was already broken or if it was going to break as a result of an upcoming change. You answered the former which is fine. 
Tempest is supposed to ensure api stability and changes like this are the "red flag" we have to take a look.

The painful thing here is that we have tempest tests that are not in the gate.
It would be even better if the full run could actually be turned on in the gate. Is that on your radar screen?'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-09-04 12:19:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

it's not really clear to me why we'd backport this, it's not a smoke test, and grizzly working with neutron is far more problematic than just this."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-09-04 21:05:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This is not a backport. It seems there are tests that are broken in neutron grizzly and I don't see why they can't be skipped. If this allows some one to run full neutron/grizzly/tempest that is sufficient reason in IMO. Even better if the result was that we could turn on full neutron in the stable branch. I think we would be better off even if there are other neutron issues."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

ok, dkranz has convinced me we should land this. Letting it through'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Skip secgroup invalid name/desc tests until bug 1161411 is fixed

There is an existing review which tries to deal with bug 1161411:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34559/

Until there is consensus on how to fix this, skip the compute tests if
neutron is available.

(cherry picked from commit 6e3454465e343922dd4c977c1e4fd84f257f5650)

Conflicts:
	tempest/tests/compute/security_groups/test_security_groups.py

Change-Id: I41bd2232ad4e489daaa8de3902d7e158f3e577bf

commit_message:
Use oslo.config for functional tests

Instead of defining a Config class for functional tests, this patch
integrates it with Marconi's base test suite and replaces the use of
ConfigParser with olso.config.

The patch doesn't change current behavior and gives the possibility to
use external configuration files for both the functional test and
Marconi.

blueprint refactor-system-tests

Change-Id: I60de6e199182881e945a24525c7c4f2d6937256f

commit_message:
Pull actual tests out of marconi/tests

As part of Marconi's test refactoring, it was decided to pull actual
tests - those run by nosetest - out of marconi/tests and leave there
just the base implementations. The main reasoning about this is to
improve tests structure and make packaging easier.

blueprint refactor-system-tests

Change-Id: Ia7f9192a2ec2c224e78bddb8414d226cb23a929f

[{'created': '2013-09-09 15:01:25.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Safe db.api.compute_node_get_all() performance improvement"

This reverts commit 1e90eb66ae999201a0b3d2e7409734c3e2f452d7.

Change mentioned above introduced a regression leading to
KeyError when a new baremetal node is scheduled. This is due
to the fact, that the mentioned change assumes, that
ComputeNode <--> Service is a 1-1 relationship, which is not true for
Nova Baremetal driver.

Closes-Bug: #1221620

Change-Id: Ie212b1ee44020f9acbed8825fe0352b369b98546
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Safe db.api.compute_node_get_all() performance improvement"

This reverts commit 1e90eb66ae999201a0b3d2e7409734c3e2f452d7.

Change mentioned above introduced a regression leading to
KeyError when a new baremetal node is scheduled. This is due
to the fact, that the mentioned change assumes, that
ComputeNode <--> Service is a 1-1 relationship, which is not true for
Nova Baremetal driver.

Closes-Bug: #1221620

Change-Id: Ie212b1ee44020f9acbed8825fe0352b369b98546

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-05 06:54:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for uploading thin provisioned vmdks to glance

We now differentiate whether vmdks are thin or thick provisioned before
we upload it to glance. If a vmdk image ends in "-thin.vmdk", then we pass
along the appropriate flag, --property vmware-disktype=thin, to the
glance image-create command.

Change-Id: I83483d20f984250bd8154d8e270b2e801d2df303
Closes-bug: #1221044
'}, {'created': '2013-09-05 23:48:06.000000000', 'message': "Provide a means of setting vmdk custom properties via image filename

Custom properties for vmdk disk type, storage adapter type, and
networking adapter type can now be retrieved from a vmdk image's
filename. The filename format is defined as:

  <name>-<disk type>:<storage adapter>:<network adapter>

An example filename following this format would be
debian-2.6.32-i646-thin:ide:VirtualE1000. If the vmdk filename does not
match the above format then underlying nova driver will supply default
values.

Change-Id: I83483d20f984250bd8154d8e270b2e801d2df303
Closes-bug: #1221044
"}, {'created': '2013-09-05 23:49:27.000000000', 'message': "Provide a means of setting vmdk custom properties via image filename

  <name>-<disk type>:<storage adapter>:<network adapter>

An example filename following this format would be
debian-2.6.32-i646-thin:ide:VirtualE1000. If the vmdk filename does not
match the above format then underlying nova driver will supply default
values.

Change-Id: I83483d20f984250bd8154d8e270b2e801d2df303
Closes-bug: #1221044
"}]
commit_message:
Provide a means of setting vmdk custom properties via image filename

Custom properties for vmdk disk type, storage adapter type, and
networking adapter type can now be retrieved from a vmdk image's
filename. The filename format is defined as:

  <name>-<disk type>:<storage adapter>:<network adapter>

An example filename following this format would be
debian-2.6.32-i646-thin:ide:VirtualE1000. If the vmdk filename does not
match the above format then underlying nova driver will supply default
values.

Change-Id: I83483d20f984250bd8154d8e270b2e801d2df303
Closes-bug: #1221044

'}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2013-09-03 11:30:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The inline comment I left in chassis.py can be also applied to other files.

Validation of patches should be done different for different kinds of objects. That's why I don't think it's a good idea to create a method like utils.validate_patch() because if will be long and will contain a lot of conditions.

I do not know Pecan in depth but I guess there might be a way of calling a specific controller's method on a specific request automatically. If so, we can create an interface method like validate_patch() which will be called before the PATCH handler."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-09-04 11:43:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for the input Roman

As I see it, at least in the moment the validation seems to be pretty generic, for example we would have to test if folk is trying to add some attribute to the root of the element which is not allowed. Some of the verifications is already made by the jsonpatch module, for example if someone tries to replace the value of an attribute that doesn't exist it will raise an Exception for that.

The use of a Pecan hook sounds like a good way to validate the request, I don't know much about Pecan either, but I will take a look at it."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-09-05 13:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-09-05 13:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-05 13:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

commit_message:
Updating resources with PATCH

This patch enables clients to update the resources using the PATCH HTTP
method. PATCH allows partial updates on the documents, reducing network
and processing overhead. Attributes may be removed, replaced, or added
in a single request.

Closes-Bug: #1220107

Change-Id: I8187f32b86f05fda58360cd3a51f07ae43742a3a

commit_message:
Remove references for the 'task_state' property

Complementing the patch 45671, this patch removes all the references of
'task_state' in the current code. The 'task_state' property was replaced
by two new properties 'power_state' and 'provision_state' on a previous
patch.

Change-Id: I1f6bbcdfcebb0e2551855fbd17e1241b9c84b741

commit_message:
Add support for latest SS result formats.

Updates our job data handling so that it works with the latest
SmokeStack job format updates. This includes:
 -new build status's for Failed, TestFail, and BuildFail
 -new job types (cloudcue)
 -display multiple jobs for each type (where appropriate)

Change-Id: I79fa21cfd489a2f524d4c98bc94b7a14b81ee831

[{'created': '2013-09-06 17:14:08.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron.common.log.log print module path

Closes-Bug: #1221663

neutron.common.log.log is useful for logging arguments of a method.
It outputs class name and method name, but module path is not output.
A module path is useful to search the log message.

Change-Id: Ic2903da750cc13980d5cdee153bb079f7d4ee122

commit_message:
Make neutron.common.log.log print module path

Closes-Bug: #1221663

neutron.common.log.log is useful for logging arguments of a method.
It outputs class name and method name, but module path is not output.
A module path is useful to search the log message.

Change-Id: Ic2903da750cc13980d5cdee153bb079f7d4ee122

commit_message:
Restrict Volume type deletion with volumes assoc

Updated volume_type_destroy method to throw exception
for volume type delete with associated volumes.

Updated volume_type unit tests

Closes-Bug: #1215329

tag:doc-impact

Change-Id: I7a5d4b473588757d21b461337df493e8046e1d09

commit_message:
Use joins instead of multiple lookups in groups sql

Currently to determine a user's groups (or vice versa) we do
- 1 lookup for the user.
- 1 lookup for the association table.
- n lookups for the n groups the user has.

The association and groups lookup are replaced with a join query.

Fixes: bug 1218675
Change-Id: I560659eda1a30635399829e1c86f06734c90f9e2

commit_message:
Limit instance fault messages to 255 characters

The instance_fault.message column is a VARCHAR(255).  By default,
MySQL silently truncates entries that are too long.  PostgreSQL
throws an error instead.  So we need to truncate the message field
before we try inserting into that column, to avoid errors from
very long messages in PostgreSQL (or MySQL configured to not allow
this).

Fixes bug #1217167

Change-Id: Ia959d64a8bc162a33ba818f1006e9779207b4796
