commit_message:
fix race condition between addCleanup and lockutils

it turns out that addCleanup is actually running much later than
anticipated, so by that time we're actually outside of the
synchronized region that lockutils has created. This means that we
have a potential race in tearing down our resources. This potential
race has become a 100% race if you turn on additional workers in
devstack, which jog0 exposed today.

Convert the lockutils usage to a fixture based approach which will
keep the lock around through the cleanup phase.

Fixes bug #1221469

Co-author: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2cb73cb64cc04077cf1595a880b124f31aa13f89

commit_message:
Updates passing of HW params to scripts

tripleo-incubator scripts now pass cpu, memory, disk, architecture
as params to create-nodes and setup-baremetal scripts. This patch
reflects the change on toci side.

Change-Id: Ib0277349dd9ef448bdf303b9a1a2cea6caad48f6

[{'created': '2013-09-09 13:44:21.000000000', 'message': 'Exception raising in TestEngine.verify()

This patch changes the interface of the TestEngine.verify() method. In the
previous version, it returned True if all tests passed and False otherwise.
This patch introduces a custom VerificationException, which is now thrown
by the verify() method in case of a failure, instead of returning False.

Blueprint test-engine

Change-Id: I0789d6c56f6952e3056e6dad022690eb90178e3d
'}]
commit_message:
Exception raising in TestEngine.verify()

This patch changes the interface of the TestEngine.verify() method. In the
previous version, it returned True if all tests passed and False otherwise.
This patch introduces a custom VerificationException, which is now thrown
by the verify() method in case of a failure, instead of returning False.

Blueprint test-engine

Change-Id: I0789d6c56f6952e3056e6dad022690eb90178e3d

commit_message:
Fix message i18n error

Partial-Bug: #1217100

Using tools/check_i18n.py to scan source directory, and fix most of
the errors.

- Message internationalization
- First letter must be capital
- Using comma instead of percent in LOG.xxx

Note: all extension's description are not touched in this patch,
can be fixed after discussing.
Note: all nicira/check_nvp_config.py print messages are not fixed.

Change-Id: I79ef06fd42f6780beb5019c592662536c2a51864

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-24 14:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes sync issue for user level resources (part2)

If a normal user created a fixed_ip/floating_ip, then the
fixed_ip/floating_ip is deleted by admin, a new reservation/usage
record will be created in the db, and it should be the right case
that the usage for fixed_ip/floating_ip of the user decreased.

Closes bug 1214523

Change-Id: I705f2f9ef327a3198da6a47df772c3a1a28e1b4e
'}, {'created': '2013-09-04 13:53:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inconsistent usages for network resources

If a normal user created a fixed_ip/floating_ip, a usage record with
column `in_use=1` will be created in the quota_usages table, and if an
admin user deleted the resource, a new record with column `in_use=-1`
will be created..This will cause the quota for the resources not
released.

Fixes bug 1220727

Change-Id: I705f2f9ef327a3198da6a47df772c3a1a28e1b4e
'}, {'created': '2013-09-05 23:14:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inconsistent usages for network resources

If a normal user created a fixed_ip/floating_ip, a usage record with
column `in_use=1` will be created in the quota_usages table, and if an
admin user deleted the resource, a new record with column `in_use=-1`
will be created..This will cause the quota for the resources not
released.

Fixes bug 1220727

Change-Id: I705f2f9ef327a3198da6a47df772c3a1a28e1b4e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistent usages for network resources

If a normal user created a fixed_ip/floating_ip, a usage record with
column `in_use=1` will be created in the quota_usages table, and if an
admin user deleted the resource, a new record with column `in_use=-1`
will be created..This will cause the quota for the resources not
released.

Fixes bug 1220727

Change-Id: I705f2f9ef327a3198da6a47df772c3a1a28e1b4e

Updated End User guide to include section to Create a Network

Included a procedure in the end user guide to create a network using the dashboard, as an end user.

commit_message:
Replace hand-rolled tempdir with fixtures.TempDir

The TempDir() fixture connects into the fixture/addCleanup
machinery which ensures the deletion of the dir even in the face of
failures or errors in the test suite.

Change-Id: I2481f57e78e6de044e0bffa9248e6fab6164fa5b

[{'created': '2013-09-04 14:41:45.000000000', 'message': "Add falcon to global-requirements

Falcon is the default wsgi framework used in Marconi. Since Marconi was
accepted as an incubated project, this patch adds this requirement to
global-requirements as part of Marconi's integration with OpenStack's
infrastructure and tools.

Change-Id: I179c875e0fc8adfad2323b31a063d2f5b7d52623
"}]
commit_message:
Add falcon to global-requirements

Falcon is the default wsgi framework used in Marconi. Since Marconi was
accepted as an incubated project, this patch adds this requirement to
global-requirements as part of Marconi's integration with OpenStack's
infrastructure and tools.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-01 22:30:30.000000000', 'message': 'openstack-ha: Networking Highly Available

Active / Passive section:
New node: network-controller
* neutron-l3-agent
* neutron-dhcp-agent
* neutron-metadata-agent

Active / Active section:
*neutron-dhcp-agent: redirect to OpenStack Networking guide
*neutron-l3-agent and neutron-metadata-agent: redirect to Active / Passive
section since they are not HA.

implements blueprint improve-high-availability-support
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
openstack-ha: Networking Highly Available

Active / Passive section:
New node: network-controller
* neutron-l3-agent
* neutron-dhcp-agent
* neutron-metadata-agent

Active / Active section:
*neutron-dhcp-agent: redirect to OpenStack Networking guide
*neutron-l3-agent and neutron-metadata-agent: redirect to Active / Passive
section since they are not HA.

implements blueprint improve-high-availability-support
Change-Id: Ie7e4f917f6c7cca05303275cd90e8415e323dfd2
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Sync filetuils from oslo-incubator

to support https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33409/

* nova/openstack/common/fileutils.py: Auto sync from oslo.
* nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py (fake_rm_on_errror):
Adjust to match the new signature of delete_if_exists()
and handle mocking out the remove parameter to
remove_path_on_error() which is initialized at load time.

Change-Id: I756f1226853366e8f418d21309b0e8dcf8a24aa2

subject: Improved MongoClient pooling to avoid out of connections error
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-05 09:29:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-09-05 09:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-05 10:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-ceilometer-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/02/45202/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/99adf9e : SUCCESS in 55s

- gate-ceilometer-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/02/45202/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/0d16a27 : SUCCESS in 4m 45s
'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-09-05 15:31:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Alexie, I am not sure how this will improve the out of
connection error. It seems to me that the only
difference is how the key is made for the pool. It was used to
be the url string, now it is an object, I can not see how
the key can affect the connection itself."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-09-05 16:12:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To understand the problem completely you need to be aware of several facts:

1) We use our own connection pool to cache MongoClient objects. With such pool we won't create new MongoClient in case it's already exists

2) We use a separate database for each tests. This is done to allow tests run concurrently without affecting each other.

3) Since we have separate databases - connection URL is different for each test. Cause of this new MongoClient instance is created and old ones are not being destroyed.

4) MongoClient keeps sockets open and reuses them to speed up queries. All the sockets are closed only when connection is explicitly closed or when object is destroyed.
Cause of #3 this leads to sockets leak during the test run.

This patch is changing the way how we use our pool of MongoClient instances. since we delete database information from pool key single MongoClient instance will be shared between all tests and existing sockets will be reused. 
We should not receive out of connections error anymore cause we won't leak opened sockets."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-09-05 17:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Alexie, ok, I thought each test cases in this method

    def tearDown(self):
        self.conn.clear()
        self.conn = None
        super(TestBase, self).tearDown()

calls conn.clear which closes the connection explicitly.
If that is not the case, probably something is missing.'}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-09-05 18:34:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes you are right and most of the objects released correctly.
It seems that there are *some* tests that don't do this cause I've done some investigation about it and I've found that in some circumstances they are not released and cause resource leak. 

I've done a series of patches recently trying to improve this and I've managed to fix a lot of issues related to this issue but I'm afraid some issues remain hidden. Hope that this patch will manage to fix it completely.

The reason I don't like the fix that landed previously it's because it's a workaround that brings unnecessary hard-code to production code and makes it dependent on tests."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-09-09 09:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 09:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Improved MongoClient pooling to avoid out of connections error

Use 1 MongoClient instance per database server determined by host:port +
connection options

Fixes bug #1218488

Change-Id: If06844f6bf09674216b029310c1a5f445c4476fe

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual - 2/2

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

This patch replaces the remaining assertEquals to assertEqual

Change-Id: I4e726ce414382e0d5bf982fad20363d61e00967a

[{'created': '2013-09-04 18:41:24.000000000', 'message': "LBaaS: Fix healthmonitor disassociation for non-admin

Due to specifics of policy engine, checked object should have
tenant_id to be checked by rule admin_or_owner.
In 'disassociate' operation neutron API layer works with
PoolHealthMonitorAssociation which doesn't have tenant_id field.
Need to add it to resulting dict returned by get_pool_health_monitor.

Change-Id: I6c58558b09ff34dedd7da30866275de44d3ba993
Closes-bug: 1220668
"}, {'created': '2013-09-09 07:55:35.000000000', 'message': "LBaaS: Fix healthmonitor disassociation for non-admin

Due to specifics of policy engine, checked object should have
tenant_id to be checked by rule admin_or_owner.
In 'disassociate' operation neutron API layer works with
PoolHealthMonitorAssociation which doesn't have tenant_id field.
Need to add it to resulting dict returned by get_pool_health_monitor.

Change-Id: I6c58558b09ff34dedd7da30866275de44d3ba993
Closes-bug: 1220668
"}]
commit_message:
LBaaS: Fix healthmonitor disassociation for non-admin

Due to specifics of policy engine, checked object should have
tenant_id to be checked by rule admin_or_owner.
In 'disassociate' operation neutron API layer works with
PoolHealthMonitorAssociation which doesn't have tenant_id field.
Need to add it to resulting dict returned by get_pool_health_monitor.

Change-Id: I6c58558b09ff34dedd7da30866275de44d3ba993
Closes-bug: 1220668

[{'created': '2013-08-20 15:29:33.000000000', 'message': "Update brick lvm module

There were a number of changes made to bricks LVM module
before it merged in Cinder that weren't in place when the
nova work started.

This patch synchs up cinder and nova versions.  The
primary change here is the we don't set a default
root_helper and now require it to be passed in as an argument.

Change-Id: Ib8123263ed466f8236951a7b56baabe5a79d20cf
"}]
commit_message:
Update brick lvm module

There were a number of changes made to bricks LVM module
before it merged in Cinder that weren't in place when the
nova work started.

This patch synchs up cinder and nova versions.  The
primary change here is the we don't set a default
root_helper and now require it to be passed in as an argument.

Change-Id: Ib8123263ed466f8236951a7b56baabe5a79d20cf

commit_message:
Pass the correct cloud type into register-nodes

The first arguments passed into register-nodes should be the cloud type,
the other args are now environment variables. Without this change all
MAC's were getting registered on both seed and undercloud.

Change-Id: I76a5260d503f2daaae11b86b43f08df093290e7f

commit_message:
Updates passing of HW params to scripts

HW params (cpu, memory, disk, architecture) are passed as params
to scripts which create/set 'baremetal' nodes, so that
scripts are not dependent on another environment variables.

Change-Id: Ic020a0dbe82e5978801aa0f615aaeb2d4d79d8d3

commit_message:
Make keystone API version configurable

This patch is to add a new option named version in
keystone::endpoint. To keep compatibility, the default
value is 'v2.0'.

Fixes bug #1222328

Change-Id: Ib75465fdb091d1caf126c2522ce845c25810aa64

commit_message:
Porting changes from Release 0.2

* Fix leaking password in murano-api logs (resolved: MRN-861)
* Added function to clean deployment description
* Updated SQLAlchemy requirement
* Changed default values of vhost, login, password (resolved: MRN-880)
* Updated requirements for murano-common
  Now murano-common is installed from pypi and has correct version requirements

Change-Id: I765808820b0ccbdb1d24c776cbe674c00822a3e4

[{'created': '2013-09-03 14:40:49.000000000', 'message': 'Send notifications when extending volume

- Send resize.start when volume extension begins.
- Send resize.end with new size when volume extension ends.

Fixes: bug #1219106
Change-Id: I729da1604668080ec1a5d096df211aa55913dc48
'}]
commit_message:
Send notifications when extending volume

- Send resize.start when volume extension begins.
- Send resize.end with new size when volume extension ends.

Fixes: bug #1219106
Change-Id: I729da1604668080ec1a5d096df211aa55913dc48

[{'created': '2013-09-05 22:28:10.000000000', 'message': "Revert baremetal v3 API extension

Baremetal is scheduled to be deprecated in Nova soon. Since
the V3 API is experimental in Havana, we should revert the
extension to avoid maintenance of the extension and its tests
for no real gain.

Things have changed enough since it was added that a simple
git-revert won't work. This reverts the following changes:

  5de5ae1b5d3763dbcf14bf3b4d43199ad5255adf
  92c9975bd2d53624ae595b895c2e96991ee43778
  2382186311794591fb4d35893ffa774157d6131b

Mailing list discussion:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/014614.html

Change-Id: I3bdc7234f91eb4f9078ee24d7ab093b28f9930c9
"}]
commit_message:
Revert baremetal v3 API extension

Baremetal is scheduled to be deprecated in Nova soon. Since
the V3 API is experimental in Havana, we should revert the
extension to avoid maintenance of the extension and its tests
for no real gain.

Things have changed enough since it was added that a simple
git-revert won't work. This reverts the following changes:

  5de5ae1b5d3763dbcf14bf3b4d43199ad5255adf
  92c9975bd2d53624ae595b895c2e96991ee43778
  2382186311794591fb4d35893ffa774157d6131b

Mailing list discussion:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/014614.html

Change-Id: I3bdc7234f91eb4f9078ee24d7ab093b28f9930c9

Minor nit pick. Comment inline."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-09-05 12:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I'm not sure we should be doing this in the API layer at all.  Why not do it in backup/manager.py's create_backup()?

Then you would end up with a record for a failed backup and the volume can become "available" again, which I think is the desired behavior.  (Your change means that no backup attempt is recorded.)'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-09-05 12:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Doing checks in the API is almost always preferable to doing it the other side of the RPC - once you've crossed the RPC, you are asynchronous and so feedback to the user is less obvious / immediate. We did add the 'fail reason' to backups to log async errors, but an immediate error at API call time is more useful if your backup is not going to even be attempted."}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-09-05 12:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-09-05 22:20:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Hi everyone, thanks for reviews.

I aggree with Duncan's comment.
I think this kind of check should be operated in API layer as possible, because the basic design of OpenStack is fail-fast and a roll-back does not fit to the design, I guess."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-09-05 23:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-09-05 23:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-06 00:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

If cinder-backup service is not enabled, "cinder backup-create"
command fails like the following. As the result, the volume status

before changing a volume status to "backing-up".

Fixes bug #1221012

commit_message:
Check cinder-backup service before "backing-up"

If cinder-backup service is not enabled, "cinder backup-create"
command fails like the following. As the result, the volume status
has been changed to "backing-up" in spite of not backing-up.

$ cinder backup-create f48aa6ae-4c35-4a6a-a393-5a5cf610945a
ERROR: Service cinder-backup could not be found.
$ cinder list
+--+------------+--------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
|ID|   Status   | Display Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to |
+--+------------+--------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
|..| backing-up |   vol-test   |  1   |     None    |  False   |             |
+--+------------+--------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
$

To avoid this situation, this patch moves the cinder-backup check
before changing a volume status to "backing-up".

Fixes bug #1221012

Change-Id: I42ad41e1cfb6fdb7feebe39a9a5f0356a41d7838

commit_message:
Move declaration of int_br_device_count earlier

_report_state is being called by setup_rpc so int_br_device_count needs
to be initialized earlier. To avoid
AttributeError: object has no attribute 'int_br_device_count'

This wasn't caught by unit tests for 3 separate reason
o The reference to self.int_br_device_count is wrapped in
  except Exception: log / pass
- This reference has been moved outside of the try/except

o Unit tests set report_interval to 0 so the heartbeat wasn't called
  during unit tests.
- now removed

o The function passed into FixedIntervalLoopingCall isn't started
  anyways so wasn't calling self._report_state
- replaced FixedIntervalLoopingCall with a mock that calls the
  function once.

Fixes bug #1221054

Change-Id: I572af4ee017c1f7f016c8f9981ca54d1301442d1

commit_message:
Do not attempt vg.update on uninitialized vg

It's possible for the scheduler to send the periodic
stats update request *before* the volume service/driver
has finished initializing, resulting in an exception trace
being logged.

This change adds a check to verify that the vg is actually
initialized (completed check_for_setup_error) and it also
removes all of the duplication of each LVM class driver.

To deal with other drivers that may have similar issues,
add initialized member to base driver, that member is
set False on __init__ and is updated by the manager
after running check_for_setup_error.  We also skip
update_stats if initialization isn't set True.

Rather than have a separate copy of update_stats in every
driver, we have one in the base LVM class and we set the two
unique variables as member parameters.

Fixes bug 1221874

Change-Id: I159e98a77782b8b2c85a8dd956b150828358fd25

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-07 08:04:23.000000000', 'message': 'Replace assertEquals with assertEqual - 1/2

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual - 1/2

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

This patch is a mere sed replace of one-liner assertEquals to assertEqual.

grep -lR "assertEquals(" cinder/tests/* | \
xargs sed -ri 's/(\W+self.assertEqual)s(.+)(\)$)/\1\2\3/'

Change-Id: I4feea94d53afa866af9b7e14bd80345fa7276e75

commit_message:
VM nodes HW specification moved into variables

Changes the way of setting HW specification of VM nodes. Instead of
passing cpu, memory and disk values to create-nodes and setup-baremetal
scripts, scripts expect preset variables NODE_CPU, NODE_MEM, NODE_DISK and
NODE_ARCH. Architecture is newely added parameter - this patch removes
hardcoded i386 architecture in the scripts.

Also updates devtest.md with 64bit related instructions:
- suggests more memory and storage caused by increased memory footprint
- adds substitution of i386 arch in config/template files

Change-Id: Ie86fecf57a187a284833acab653fe1596725cdf9
Fixes: bug #1216864
Fixes: bug #1216814

commit_message:
Use environment variables to define node resources

tripleo-incubator has switched to using environment variables to define
whats resources are allocated to bm_poseur nodes.

Also adds back in support for amd64 arch

Change-Id: I246c69b863a4e85a62039dc43136b74e199ecc79

commit_message:
Fixes duplicate subnet addition in add_floaters.py

While there was a check to make sure that the public network
was already created, there was no such check to ensure that
the subnet for floating IP addresses had not already been
created...

Change-Id: Ib494f9796f89932fd1b87d2d4fa548bd94f29d7b

commit_message:
Adjust validate.py for flattened directory structure

With this change validate.py validates and builds again the manuals.

I disabled validation of basic-install-pom.xml as it's a pom.xml
file.
Currently the basic-install guide is not build at all.

Change-Id: I1505f3c52869b860475d2061474e4bca1aec1bab

commit_message:
Update docs.o.o/trunk/index for new manuals

I've added a new section "Use an OpenStack Cloud" and added all manuals.
I'm not sure whether all links are correct.

Also added a WIP note for now.

Change-Id: Ia79457a6edddcfc609cbe6a4472507268c6e7fff
Partial-Bug: #1220407

commit_message:
Support to specify generic auth_version

Now auth_version matched the regex "v?3(\.\d)?" is support,
and if it's not v3 we will log a deprecation warning.

Fixes: bug #1164445

Change-Id: I61675a45f56e9ad829dcf4e11419a17f2ecfb855

I'm going to hold off on this until some other folks have time to comment.

The value you shared is the expected default for havana. IIRC, we experienced issues where security rules did not work correctly with Grizzly with that driver."}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-07-29 20:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ok no problem, I believe this is correct even for Grizzly, it is the same here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/grizzly/etc/nova/nova.conf.sample

And at the link below it states that the default values in nova.conf suffice for most plugins (including OVS):
http://docs.openstack.org/grizzly/openstack-network/admin/content/nova_with_quantum_vifplugging.html'}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-07-29 20:19:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

For what it's worth, this is already the default in puppet-openstack:

https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-openstack/blob/master/manifests/compute.pp#L65"}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:50:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The never-ending VIF discussion... :-)

The issue we hit is that with grizzly+ovs+quantum, Quantum security groups don't work unless you use the HybridOVS VIF. We've switched back from GenericVIF to HybridOVS because of that"}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Was there ever a bug filed to that effect? Everything I read says that LibvirtGenericVIFDriver is the way to go in Grizzly'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-07-31 12:46:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

When I looked at the code it looked like it's not a bug and more just a case that generic didn't have that feature in grizzly. Havana appears to support on generic (untested by me though)"}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-07-31 17:10:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think we are thinking of Folsom (hear me out):

If you look at the history of this repo (puppet-nova), it used to look like this:
https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-nova/blob/892bd580473d36afbb213eab8808f6e9f80816c0/manifests/compute/quantum.pp

LibvirtHybirdOVSBridgeDriver was commented out, and LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver has been used since 2012.

The folsom documentation here:
http://docs.openstack.org/folsom/openstack-network/admin/content/nova_with_quantum_vifplugging_ovs.html

States that you use HybirdOVSBridgeDriver for Nova security groups, and OpenVswitchDriver if you're not using Nova security groups.

The vif drivers in Grizzly (here: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/grizzly/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py#L509-L512)

states that LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver is only retained for vif drivers that do not support looking up vif_type (the OVS plugin supports it).

I think you guys are thinking of your move from HybirdOVSBridgeDriver > OpenVswitchDriver"}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-01 03:52:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Your commit message needs an update to comply with the guideline:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Summary_of_GIT_commit_message_structure

The 2nd line should be blank. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-08-01 12:14:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We're thinking of grizzly

In https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-openstack/commit/94a409665773eedb26936df75cf9ea72a3436709 a couple months back Daneyon set the openstack module on the generic VIF since the other VIFs will deprecate in havana. We've since revisited that and at least internally are using hybridOVS since we want quantum+ovs+quantum security groups

I agree that we want these consistent by default everywhere so it'd be best to either bring this in, or drop this and change the above for consistency

Dan is correct though, that we've backed away from generic in grizzly because of quantum security groups not yet working with it and OVS"}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-01 13:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-08-01 13:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-01 13:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Please follow git guideline to update the commit message. And I would add a quantum core reviewer to comment this."}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-02 13:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

What is wrong with the commit message?'}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-08-02 13:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Please reference here: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Summary_of_GIT_commit_message_structure'}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-02 13:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

You're going to need to be more specific, I can take the pressure haha just tell me straight-up what you see that is wrong."}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-08-02 14:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This link is a good start for how to writing a good commit message, recommend for reading.
First, do not assume the reviewer understands what the original problem was.
So it' important to provide a brief description of the change in the first line.
I don't think "Use the correct vif_driver default" is suitable, maybe "Fix param libvirt_vif_driver's default value" is a bit better.
Second, provide a detailed description of the change in the following lines. The commit message must contain all the information required to fully understand & review the patch for correctness.'}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-02 14:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-08-02 14:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-02 14:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-08-04 22:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-08-08 09:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

When will we rename the quantum into neutron in puppet?'}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-08-08 10:07:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@gongysh  yes, it's in the process, ref here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40252/
Could you give some comments on this patch?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-08-13 03:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-13 04:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Let me confirm the detail.

If you use Nova security group implementation, the generic vif driver works. If you use Neutron security group implementation, we still need LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver.

The old vif_driver is LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver. In this case, the security group feature does not work whether which security group implementation (from nova or neutron) is used. Anyway we need to change the vif driver configuration from the old one if you need the security group feature.

Neutron team is working to make the generic vif driver work with OVS plugin and neutron security group in H-3.'}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-13 15:03:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Well it looks like I stand corrected :) I apologize for my stubbornness. I guess the question then is, should it be changed to LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver, or to LibvirtGenericVIFDriver, either way it looks like LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver is not correct (based on Akihiro's comments).

The manifests use the neutron security api by default (https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/network/neutron.pp#L81)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-14 11:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver is the right configuration of vif_driver when neutron security group api is used. The manifest file really helps me.'}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-14 18:33:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So I'm curious as to what people think the default should be, here is my suggestion:

1. Make GenericVIF the default, as this should be correct by the time Havana is released for both Nova and Neutron security groups.

2. Put a warning/fail in puppet-openstack for the time being if a user tries to use an incompatible combination of security_group_api and libirt_vif_driver"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-15 20:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I am not entirely sure the generic vif driver will allow to perform the hybrid pluggin necesary for executing neutron security groups with the ovs plugin.'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-21 15:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can anyone do a real test on their setup or ask #openstack-nova?'}, {'account_id': 6967, 'date': '2013-08-21 15:57:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Dan's and my comments are from real tests"}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-21 16:22:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Your comments and Dan's ones are about Grizzly. What about Havana? The master branch is targeting Havana now.

Neutron people are suggesting LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver instead of LibvirtGenericVIFDriver."}, {'account_id': 6850, 'date': '2013-08-28 15:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It still looks like GenericVIF is correct in Havana, see here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py#L739-L743

As well as this commit:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/3a8b2daa461ceab51cd4642583c91b17e6fc9287'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-09-01 14:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Status update from the neutron team.

At the moment, when using the generic driver, security group does not work with OVS plugin either nova or neutron implementation is used since the generic driver does not setup the hybrid driver.

Now we neutron team is working to make the generic driver configure the hybrid driver. I hope this can be merged in Havana.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-09 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-09 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Use the correct vif_driver default

As taken from:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/grizzly/etc/nova/nova.conf.sample#L2003

According to:
http://docs.openstack.org/grizzly/openstack-network/admin/content/nova_with_quantum_vifplugging.html

The OVS plugin support the "port bindings" API extension
that allows Nova to query for the type of vif-plugging required.

It further states that "the default values in nova.conf are sufficient"

This updates libvirt_vif_driver to nova.conf's default

Change-Id: I527a3e64be26725165d2dec1971d6bb07d0743e6

run_tests.sh -N -p
it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your

supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to remind user.

Bug #1215401

commit_message:
emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p
it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, check wherther hacking can be imported, if not,
emit warning to stderr to remind user.

Also, add more info in usage help.

Test method
-----------
Suppose hacking is not installed on your host

$ ./run_tests.sh -p
no warning

$ ./run_tests.sh -p -N
emit warning

$ source .venv/bin/activate
$ ./run_tests.sh -p
no warning

$ ./run_tests.sh -p -N
no warning

Bug #1215401

Change-Id: I60d7ea4b975ba3388a42a5312559ecf72b99d1b8

commit_message:
Handle removed files in tools/validate.py

Previously if a file was removed, no checks were done that the file
was not referenced anywhere.

Now you get e.g.:
Checking for removed files
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/common/section_keystone_cli_users_tenants_roles.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user-admin/src/section_cli_set_block_storage_quotas.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user-admin/src/section_cli_set_compute_quotas.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user-admin/src/section_keystone_cli_manage_projects_users.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user/src/section_cli_help.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user/src/section_cli_install.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user/src/section_cli_openrc.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user/src/section_cli_overview.xml
  Removed file: doc/src/docbkx/openstack-user/src/section_cli_version.xml
  File section_compute-configure-quotas.xml has an xi:include on deleted file ../openstack-user-admin/src/section_cli_set_compute_quotas.xml

And validate.py exists with error code to mark this as failure.

Also, limit number of parallel build jobs to 4 to reduce Jenkins load,
hope we see less org.apache.fop.fonts.FontTriplet.
Related-Bug: # 1221721

Change-Id: I3e47217958840f61347f71b159414928f266d6d5

Malini,

commit_message:
Adjust validate.py for flattened directory structure

With this change validate.py validates and builds again the manuals.

I disabled validation of basic-install-pom.xml as it's a pom.xml
file.
Currently the basic-install guide is not build at all.

Change-Id: I9cabab5e03266ac7d5d4452ddbf97ea6d9dcdf3a

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/17/45517/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/9082861 : SUCCESS in 33s
'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 04:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I removed the parent dirs doc/src, but I kept "docbkx" because it's parallel with "www" and "tools." I removed "src" dir from within each book folder. I renamed files to use consistent naming (ch_, section_, and so on). I moved the "basic-install" files to a folder inside the "install-guide" folder - if you want to delete that, you can - didn't know if those files are still needed.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-09-07 05:37:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Wow! I've checked this out locally to see the structure and like it. You need an update of validate.py as well, I'll send a separate patch."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-09-07 15:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Wellll... thinking. If you put them in a docbkx directory, should the folder with high-availability-guide actually be in asciidoc/high-availability-guide?

I was thinking:

doc
www
tools
book-name
book-name
book-name'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 18:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So Anne, you're saying I should rename the docbkx directory to "doc," but also book the book folders at the same level as doc? What would go into the doc folder? Please clarify. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 18:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-07 18:55:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 18:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-07 18:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/17/45517/3/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/088b8f7 : SUCCESS in 35s
'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 19:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Anne, I renamed "docbkx" to "doc." If you want me to eliminate that directory altogether, let me know. I think it's useful, but I can be convinced!'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-09-07 19:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Diane, I think you've got it correct with using 'doc' and having the books under that."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-09-07 19:18:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'm fine with the rename to doc"}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 20:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-07 20:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/17/45517/4/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/82a1844 : SUCCESS in 35s

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/17/45517/5/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/8855a9c : SUCCESS in 32s
'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 20:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

sorry for the switch-around - i tried it without the "doc" directory, but I think it's better with it. I'm sticking with this version.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-09-07 23:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I like this,just one more question: what about moving glossary into its own "book" directory since it does have a pom.xml?

What the -infra team was thinking of is this:

doc/$DOC_NAME/pom.xml

where we write a single doc build job and substitute $DOC_NAME with the directory name, for example. That "template" would work for everything here except for the glossary. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-09-07 23:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

good.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-09-08 06:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I agree with Anne, can we move glossary to doc/glossary?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-09-08 14:12:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Yep, talked to Diane this morning and we'll move. I've changed the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45490 to reflect doc/glossary/pom.xml."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-09-08 14:28:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Folder rename, file rename, flattening of directories

Current folder name	New folder name	        Book title
----------------------------------------------------------
basic-install 	        DELETE
cli-guide	        DELETE
common	                common
NEW	                admin-guide-cloud	Cloud Administrators Guide
docbkx-example	        DELETE
openstack-block-storage-admin 	DELETE
openstack-compute-admin 	DELETE
openstack-config 	config-reference	OpenStack Configuration Reference
openstack-ha 	        high-availability-guide	OpenStack High Availabilty Guide
openstack-image	        image-guide	OpenStack Virtual Machine Image Guide
openstack-install 	install-guide	OpenStack Installation Guide
openstack-network-connectivity-admin 	admin-guide-network 	OpenStack Networking Administration Guide
openstack-object-storage-admin 	DELETE
openstack-security 	security-guide	OpenStack Security Guide
openstack-training 	training-guide	OpenStack Training Guide
openstack-user 	        user-guide	OpenStack End User Guide
openstack-user-admin 	user-guide-admin	OpenStack Admin User Guide
glossary	        NEW        	OpenStack Glossary

bug: #1220407

Change-Id: Id5ffc774b966ba7b9a591743a877aa10ab3094c7
author: diane fleming

for consistency in build jobs.

Change-Id: I41af76f569d0b93b0d25750c529918328b9ea946
"}, {'created': '2013-09-06 22:50:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't stacktrace on ImageNotFound in image_snapshot

snapshot_instance stacktrace when nova.image.glance raises
ImageNotFound, but this is an expected error and no reason to stacktrace
for it.

Fix bug 1221925

Change-Id: I41af76f569d0b93b0d25750c529918328b9ea946
"}]
commit_message:
Don't stacktrace on ImageNotFound in image_snapshot

snapshot_instance stacktrace when nova.image.glance raises
ImageNotFound, but this is an expected error and no reason to stacktrace
for it.

Fix bug 1221925

Change-Id: I41af76f569d0b93b0d25750c529918328b9ea946

messages:
[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-09-03 14:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-03 14:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-lint http://logs.openstack.org/85/44885/1/check/gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-lint/5edc235 : SUCCESS in 2s

- gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-unit-3.0 http://logs.openstack.org/85/44885/1/check/gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-unit-3.0/f642722 : SUCCESS in 40s
- gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-unit-3.1 http://logs.openstack.org/85/44885/1/check/gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-unit-3.1/efb56ef : SUCCESS in 35s
'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-09-03 15:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Functionally this looks fine.

Why not just use cinder_config? Also, we don't seem to have control_exchange in some of the other modules so would we add it to puppet-nova as well (for example)?"}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-09-03 16:53:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I understand your point of view and it was mine. However It wasn't not the point of view of other people in the previously months. Multiple changes got merged that imply no logic and could have been handled by a *_config or Hiera. (syslog, memcached, auth_uri, verbose, debug, scheduler, filter, driver, etc.)

But I guess people don't want to maintain such things in their own manifests and prefer it to be handled by the module. Otherwise, I would have -2 a lot of changes in the past months as most implies no logic."}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-09-04 02:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

LGTM.
I agree with Mathieu. I think these are base options. For me, I prefer not to maintain a bunch of params which are frequently used.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-09 01:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.

[{'created': '2013-09-03 14:37:27.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to configure control_exchange

Add control_exchange parameter with default to 'openstack'.

The control_exchange configuration defaults to 'openstack' in Cinder.

Fixes: bug #1220272
Change-Id: Ic15e471a745568e5183ad9eedba92c213026309e
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to configure control_exchange

Add control_exchange parameter with default to 'openstack'.

The control_exchange configuration defaults to 'openstack' in Cinder.

Fixes: bug #1220272
Change-Id: Ic15e471a745568e5183ad9eedba92c213026309e

This looks like the content I wanted changed but I'm not seeing the changes in my local build (still old info...)"}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-06 20:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-06 20:47:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-06 20:49:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

nits picked.

Can some one verify this is landing in the install guides?

It's clearly the same content and I see the include, but my local build seems unchanged. If it's just my local mvn that's weird but OK. If I'm hacking in the wrong direction can anyone point the way?"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-09-06 21:41:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To build the RHEL version locally, change the pom.xml lines 14 and 16 from
<operating.system>apt</operating.system>
    <!-- This is set by Jenkins to run twice for each similar operating system group -->
    <profile.os>ubuntu;debian</profile.os>
to
<operating.system>yum</operating.system>
    <!-- This is set by Jenkins to run twice for each similar operating system group -->
    <profile.os>rhel;centos;fedora</profile.os>

Save the pom.xml with those changes and then run mvn clean generate-sources. 

You can either change it back for your check in, or leave it.

However in this case I think we need to track back to where the xi:include really lives. In this case, it's not in the install guide at all but in the Configuration Reference and the Compute Admin Guide. Build those two to see your content. Then I would also update the install guide to share this content as well so we don't have to maintain it in multiple places, right?"}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-07 00:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Anne,

I found the main issue most (all?) of common/section_dashboard-configure.xml is replicated in common/section_dashboard-install.xml

so it's more work than I planned to step in (it always is :) ) but still fortuitous that I fixed the "wrong" place first'}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-07 02:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-07 02:59:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I couldn't figure out a proper include that would work for both files in all locations so opened another bug rather than block content fix on it.  See revised commit message for details."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-07 03:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/91/45491/3/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/8d61c9f : SUCCESS in 5m 07s
'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-09-07 04:58:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

Some editorial suggestions."}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-07 16:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4625, 'date': '2013-09-07 16:25:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Good comments Diane,  not content I'd edited, but that's what I get for not watching my white space changes :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-07 16:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/91/45491/4/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/34d981b : SUCCESS in 4m 54s

Merging this in prior to the rename, should rebase just fine. Thanks Jon!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-08 22:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-08 22:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-08 22:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Add HSTS and cookie security to dashboard example config

Adds reccomended settings from
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ossn/+bug/1191050
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ossn/+bug/1191051
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/deployment.html#secure-site-recommendations
to the configuration instructions for HTTPS

Also includes some gramatical and formating fixes

Affects install guides, compute admin guide, and configuration guide

Note the content is in two nearly identical locations
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1222006
has been opened for the organizational bug.
This fixes the content of both locations identically.

Change-Id: I1b41b3bee0d884ca3d29a1f2667e5b55070131cb
Closes-Bug: #1210409

commit_message:
Stop hard-coding the OpenStack PyPI mirror.

os-svc-install doesn't need to hard-code the OpenStack PyPI mirror :
doing so prevents the pypi element from fully benefiting image builds,
and the pypi-openstack element can select the OpenStack PyPI mirror
when that is needed.

Change-Id: Ibc73d11d776c89cf1b4ff12cdcd5b8d8b76a176d

Also I think this behaviour can be done by setting 
PIP_INDEX_URL=http://pypi.openstack.org/openstack/ (havn't tried it) if so wouldn't documenting this be better then a new element as it would give us the same functionality but also allow people to use an alternative cache?"}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-09-08 12:50:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45564/ has the requirements change that will populate the mirror.

We can land this first, as you can just not use the mirror and instead use pypi directly; the mirror is a performance/reliability thing, not semantic.

commit_message:
Add an OpenStack PyPI mirror element.

os-svc-install could use this, and we need to ensure that all things
installed from pip, not just os-svc-install tasks, get installed from
the OpenStack PyPI mirror for test runs.

Change-Id: I243a4dc34f3a2d60c4ce6886e9bb694e708a54ab

commit_message:
Drop deps on heat-cfntools.

We're meant to be using os-collect-config now, but rabbitmq-server and
nagios3 were sucking heat-cfntools in unintentionally. They should
never have depended on heat-cfntools, as it's dependencies were solely
on os-apply-config and os-refresh-config : the way those are invoked
is not their problem.

Change-Id: I3c8b92931055192a7b9220cdc5d66a2a444ae33f

Image has spelling-error lines under "Hadoop" -> -1. Also, I'd prefer it were Ambari Savanna Plugin, but I won't -1 on that point. Also also, I conceptually think of Savanna Controller on top of the stack, next layer down is OpenStack Infrastructure, which includes the plugin, but I won't -1 on that point either.

I really prefer the distinction that there is an Ambari Savanna plugin and when Hortonworks productizes Savanna they put the HDP plugin in place - maybe the same code, maybe patched after QE, support, etc. So the discussion about what the Savanna community will support for an image may differ from what Hortonworks will support in their product.

Kudos for explaining what is in a pre-populated image. We should get that automated via dib-elements.

I'm somewhat uncomfortable w/ the merging of Hortonworks product language and Savanna community language.

-1 only for the read spelling-error in the image.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-04 20:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
fix run_tests.sh error

TypeError will be reported When running unit tests shown as "TypeError:
__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'choices'", this patchset
will fix the issue by removing the choices property.

fixes bug #1222174

Change-Id: I5bfe2edf032eedae942ce582df9d97577aabedc3

commit_message:
Change cfn-signal option --exit to --exit-code

According cfn user guide, the long option of cfn-signal -e should be
--exit-code.

Fixes bug #1220080

Change-Id: Id4e9feefd387a744f5e933aa4e9ea8a6f6f02a7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-06 19:52:44.000000000', 'message': 'Replace cinder::client class declaration with include

The nova::api class currently declares the cinder::client
class. Having this dependency set as a declaration leads
to issues when you try to combine the nova::api class
with other classes that also need to include the
cinder::client class (ie openstack::client).

This commit changes the declaration to an include to
ensure that this class can be combined with all other
classes without conflict.

Change-Id: I9c6604acfbde4c00629c9ab658f81b9444e85f7f
(cherry picked from commit 33996781540ef57ac0d3eb121845fa0eef372ed2)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace cinder::client class declaration with include

The nova::api class currently declares the cinder::client
class. Having this dependency set as a declaration leads
to issues when you try to combine the nova::api class
with other classes that also need to include the
cinder::client class (ie openstack::client).

This commit changes the declaration to an include to
ensure that this class can be combined with all other
classes without conflict.

Change-Id: I9c6604acfbde4c00629c9ab658f81b9444e85f7f
(cherry picked from commit 33996781540ef57ac0d3eb121845fa0eef372ed2)

commit_message:
Replace cinder::client class declaration with include

The nova::api class currently declares the cinder::client
class. Having this dependency set as a declaration leads
to issues when you try to combine the nova::api class
with other classes that also need to include the
cinder::client class (ie openstack::client).

This commit changes the declaration to an include to
ensure that this class can be combined with all other
classes without conflict.

Change-Id: I9c6604acfbde4c00629c9ab658f81b9444e85f7f

[{'created': '2013-09-04 22:16:11.000000000', 'message': 'Validate VV Set exists in 3PAR drivers

The 3PAR drivers must first create a volume and then add that
volume to a virtual volume set on the backend for QoS support.
If that predefined virutal volume set does not exists the
volume would not be associated with the correct QoS settings.
This patch will now look to see if the virtaul volume set
exists and if not will delete the volume and notify the user
that the VV Set does not exists.

Change-Id: I460f6dd7001362b850c49454c78673aecd4cfef0
Fixes: bug 1218554
'}]
commit_message:
Validate VV Set exists in 3PAR drivers

The 3PAR drivers must first create a volume and then add that
volume to a virtual volume set on the backend for QoS support.
If that predefined virutal volume set does not exists the
volume would not be associated with the correct QoS settings.
This patch will now look to see if the virtaul volume set
exists and if not will delete the volume and notify the user
that the VV Set does not exists.

Change-Id: I460f6dd7001362b850c49454c78673aecd4cfef0
Fixes: bug 1218554

[{'created': '2013-09-07 02:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused/redundant methods in cinder/test.py

The following methods are not used anywhere in Cinder
- assertDictListMatch()
- assertSubDictMatch()

The following methods are implemented in testtools
- assertIn()
- assertNotIn()

Change-Id: Iea96f7761c33ac774b5b4ae71e544aa007ba1bb2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused/redundant methods in cinder/test.py

The following methods are not used anywhere in Cinder
- assertDictListMatch()
- assertSubDictMatch()

The following methods are implemented in testtools
- assertIn()
- assertNotIn()

Change-Id: Iea96f7761c33ac774b5b4ae71e544aa007ba1bb2

[{'created': '2013-09-05 16:52:18.000000000', 'message': 'Synchronize extend_volume methods in 3PAR drivers

The extend_volume methods in the HP3PAR FC and
iSCSI drivers should have been synchronized with
the synchronize annotation, but were not.

Change-Id: Ic7f18b7314e10dfb499b16f43b72367fe3ed1176
Closes-Bug: #1220947
'}]
commit_message:
Synchronize extend_volume methods in 3PAR drivers

The extend_volume methods in the HP3PAR FC and
iSCSI drivers should have been synchronized with
the synchronize annotation, but were not.

Change-Id: Ic7f18b7314e10dfb499b16f43b72367fe3ed1176
Closes-Bug: #1220947

commit_message:
Add support for LocalConnector type in brick

GPFS and other file based drivers require a LocalConnector to support
volume connection and migration operations.

Modify brick/initiator/connector.py to add LocalConnector class.

Modify test_brick_connector.py to extend test_factory to include LocalConnector
class.

Modify test_gpfs.py to include new migrate_volume test.

Modify test_utils.py to extend test_brick_get_connector to include LocalConnector
class.

Closes-Bug: #1218052

Change-Id: I259fae339c2df7ae304a91c80c27d135762041f5

commit_message:
Import modules from package

Add function import_modules_from_package into rally.utils
Use import_modules_from_package in deplog and vmprovide for load engines and providers

Change-Id: I42400db8cc8f1d8ba2a14f3195df71dc60cae036

commit_message:
Add auth plugins

Historically we had auth_system in novaclient used for Rackspace Cloud
key based auth system.

Using auth plugins in keystoneclient makes easy to add new auth
mechanisms in keystoneclient as well as in third-party libraries.
Auth plugins can be discovered dynamically using stevedore and
chosen by auth system name.

Implements: blueprint keystoneclient-auth-system

Change-Id: Ie98c4f1ef0c83263e39129d40c643596a7cd67d9

commit_message:
Expose ESXi host in hypervisor-list with vSphere Driver

(WORKINPROGRESS) - This is just a prototype, trying a few things out.

I'll follow up with email to dev list etc and start a BP when ready

Change-Id: I7fdadbf6e98fdcb7c6926c23528894ba2159e47b

[{'created': '2013-09-07 02:34:49.000000000', 'message': "Allow backends to be modules/objects instead of strings

Instead of forcing a logbook creator to provide a backend
that is a string, allow for the logbook backend to be an
arbitary module/object that implements the backend api.

This is useful so that users of logbooks can easily alter
and change the backend that will store logbooks without
having to go through the registration process that exists
currently in the backend api (they can still use this if
they desire).

Also fixes a bug where when a module was given to the logbook
and in the memory backend a deep copy would be performed which
would then start to deep copy the memory api backend itself,
which would fail since the memory backend contains locks which
can not be deep copied. Remove that deep copying since it really
isn't useful to perform (and the memory backend is mainly for
testing purposes anyway).

Change-Id: I14624806f3d6cbe5347bc590078ce506be64a180
"}]
commit_message:
Allow backends to be modules/objects instead of strings

Instead of forcing a logbook creator to provide a backend
that is a string, allow for the logbook backend to be an
arbitary module/object that implements the backend api.

This is useful so that users of logbooks can easily alter
and change the backend that will store logbooks without
having to go through the registration process that exists
currently in the backend api (they can still use this if
they desire).

Also fixes a bug where when a module was given to the logbook
and in the memory backend a deep copy would be performed which
would then start to deep copy the memory api backend itself,
which would fail since the memory backend contains locks which
can not be deep copied. Remove that deep copying since it really
isn't useful to perform (and the memory backend is mainly for
testing purposes anyway).

Change-Id: I14624806f3d6cbe5347bc590078ce506be64a180

commit_message:
Allow provides to be a set and results to be a dictionary

Instead of forcing task provides to be a tuple or list and
using the corresponding numerical index to determine how to
interpret the tasks results we should also allow for the task
provides to be a set and then allow for the tasks result to be
interpreted as a dictionary.

Fixes bug 1221998

Change-Id: Ibae689e7975d6782aa248d2b6e3691c44a89ef9f

commit_message:
Temporary fix agent-compute dpkg bug 1221945

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1221945
The ubuntu cloud archive ceilometer-agent-compute pkg has a bug in which init
script isn't installing properly gets installed as:
/etc/init/ceilometer-agent.conf.dpk-new therefore until it gets fixed this temp
solution works

Change-Id: I0f017c834e23fb731e5ca57fb9ab90826072c1cd

Allow engines to be copied to integrated projects via
update.py and for the time being blacklist threaded and
graph flow from being copied (to avoid breakage) until

the utils module (since no utils.py file no longer

desired due to how 'reading' a key in a defaultdict
actually creates that key using the default value which
caused these extra module inclusions.

commit_message:
Allow engines to be copied + blacklist broken flows

Allow engines to be copied to integrated projects via
update.py and for the time being blacklist threaded and
graph flow from being copied (to avoid breakage) until
the bugs associated with fixing those flows are fixed.

Also a bug was found that would not allow copying over
the utils module (since a utils.py file no longer
exists) so ensure that when we encounter a module (and
not a .py file) we can copy over the correct file that
belongs to that module (in the case of utils this would
be the __init__.py of the utils folder).

Also fixes a bug where it appears that due to our usage
of defaultdict we would copy over more modules than
desired due to how 'reading' a key in a defaultdict
actually creates that key using the default value which
caused these extra module inclusions.

Change-Id: I2aa732fc0baf269ee87aa72bfe8495e51ad21faf

commit_message:
Set a small max_template_size for test_long_yaml

Currently this test takes 22 seconds to run. As the intent
of the test seems to be to assert that limits are enforced,
this change reduces the default limit to speed test execution time.

Change-Id: Ie12c53b832c993711c2187004d015b65045da901
Fixes-Bug: #1221478

commit_message:
Only validate credentials on create based on resources

This change relaxes the validation which checked for credentials
on stack create and update.

As implemented, having any of the following resources
in the template will result in credentials being mandatory
on create and update:
* AWS::AutoScaling::ScalingPolicy
* OS::Heat::HARestarter
* AWS::CloudFormation::WaitConditionHandle

For all other templates, credentials are not needed.

When trusts are merged, this logic could also be used to decide
whether a trust token needs to be created at all.

Fixes bug: #1217617

Change-Id: I3e4b8698d3712053dc3c0851433ef0cbbadbdfed

commit_message:
Adjust validate.py for flattened directory structure

With this change validate.py validates and builds again the manuals.

I disabled validation of basic-install-pom.xml as it's a pom.xml
file.
Currently the basic-install guide is not build at all.

Change-Id: Ib6258486877628a713a5bb4ac8ea53290d6d8300

commit_message:
Flesh out LBaaS Workflow example

Add info on how to find subnet ID, available options
for flags used and some optional flags I feel are important
(--connection-limit and --session-persistence).

Also made some formatting changes to improve readablity.

Change-Id: I35e1d441c5eb4db3db49c520c8f1167e7348d7a5
Closes-Bug: #1221739

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-06 01:50:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for bug 1221486

Initially the symptom looks like race condition between two threads when stopping the task manager. After further analysis/troubleshooting, it turns out that two threads are spawned if a task manager is stopped and started again, causing unexpected errors.

The if check on the spawned thread is always false making the start() method thinks no thread has been started. Change the check to compare against None.

Also fixed a problme in unit-test where a thread may never terminated when a stop call is invoked during db access.

Closes-Bug: 1221486
Change-Id: I0d67bfe8fef7a390f0d6bc0f5a42835f86a9fb27

commit_message:
Fix IF checks on spawned green thread instance

Initially the symptom looks like race condition between two threads when
stopping the task manager. After further analysis/troubleshooting, it
turns out that two threads are spawned if a task manager is stopped and
started again, causing unexpected errors.

The IF check on the spawned thread sometimes return True sometime return False
if not compared against None explicitly. This makes start() method
think no thread has been started or stop() method think no thread is started.
Change the check to compare against None.

Also fixed a problem in unit-test where a thread may never terminated when
a stop call is invoked during db access.

Closes-Bug: 1221486
Change-Id: I0d67bfe8fef7a390f0d6bc0f5a42835f86a9fb27

commit_message:
Create Router on network topology fails

- just wrong definition of urls, missing '
- also add '{% load url from 'future' %} to maintain Django 1.4
  compatibility

Fixes bug 1219078

Change-Id: I661ab0561bab24c1af864a7fbd0e6913f6dfed06

VPNaaS UI implementation

This is an implementation of VPNaaS UI.

implements blueprint vpnaas-ui.

Change-Id: I6c92505bb07399ba83e6b7fd7dd75f0fd1b4b2a8

commit_message:
Utilize assertIsInstance

Using assertTrue and the 'isinstance' function to test
if an object is in an instance of some class is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsInstance which was created
for these types of tests. Let's use assertIsInstance for these tests.

Change-Id: I2c931a52ae20f072f53210bf3dedb47127b413c0

commit_message:
Merge with Oslo

Update modules to a117358d4215ad5ccbc378107f69966abe14bb2a
which includes the following commits:

    3198881 Add common methods required to allow translation
            of REST API responses
    df3f2ba BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6
    79ee367 Add more robust gettext interpolation handling
    45e0cbe python3: Add basic python3 compatibility.
    1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
    d28fa69 python3: Add python3 compatibility.
    67bd769 python3: Fix traceback while running python3.
    b0c51ec Refactors to_bytes
    472d8ed Add slugify to strutils
    7119e29 Enable hacking H404 test.
    4246ce0 Added common code into fileutils and strutils.
    e3545f8 Enable hacking H402 test
    484a1df Enable hacking H403 test
    50cae76 Add basic lazy gettext implementation

Change-Id: I274b9111fe1d7de0c2585d96b90608732f80cc18

commit_message:
Merge with Oslo-incubator (2548344)

This merges rpc/ from Oslo-incubator, which includes the following
changs:

    bec54ac  Fix case error in qpid exchange type "direct"
    61c4cde  Ensure context type is handled when using to_dict
    223f9e1  Clarify precedence of secret_key_file
    a035f95  Don't shadow cfg import in securemessage
    0f88575  Remove redundant global keyword in securemessage
    848c4d5  Some nitpicky securemessage cleanups
    5c71c25  Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage
    9157286  RPC: Add MessageSecurity implementation
    2031e60  Refactors boolean returns
    34a6842  On reconnecting a FanoutConsumer, don't grow the topic name
    f52446c  Add serializer param to RPC service
    5ff534d  Add config for amqp durable/auto_delete queues
    f9f1b4f  Revert "Add support for heartbeating in the kombu RPC driver"
    7bfd443  Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute
    c37f6aa  Add support for heartbeating in the kombu RPC driver

Change-Id: Iabc814147b359e810548b7ac906d4e1c52a20df3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-06 04:04:07.000000000', 'message': "Utilizes assertIsNotNone

Using assertTrue and the 'is not' operator to test if an element
is not None is too python2.4. Our unit testing framework supports
assertIsNotNone, included from python 2.7, which was created
for these types of tests.

Change-Id: I25c3f2b144357a3f86625deb8e324d78c20b9ce4
"}]
commit_message:
Utilizes assertIsNotNone

Using assertTrue and the 'is not' operator to test if an element
is not None is too python2.4. Our unit testing framework supports
assertIsNotNone, included from python 2.7, which was created
for these types of tests.

Change-Id: I25c3f2b144357a3f86625deb8e324d78c20b9ce4

commit_message:
Remove deprecated assert_() usage

The method assert_() is an alias of assertTrue() and
is deprecated since python 2.7

http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

This removes all assert_() uses.

Change-Id: I9f55c442cc2416a7aa2dac569d1750f723d95184

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 16:39:02.000000000', 'message': 'fix inconsistent i18n log message

An inconsistent example:
    imessage = _("Invalid metadata") + ": %(reason)s"
This is not consistent i18n usage. In most of cases, we use _() for
whole string instead of leaving something out.

More than inconsistent, some text in leaving strings may be not
translated, for example, ':' in English is different 'ï¼' in Chinese.

Change-Id: I00e690021c44f1debbe034cc0837a07b292ffd1b
Closes-Bug: #1220813

commit_message:
fix inconsistent i18n log message

An inconsistent example:
    imessage = _("Invalid metadata") + ": %(reason)s"
This is not consistent i18n usage. In most of cases, we use _() for
whole string instead of leaving something out.

More than inconsistent, some text in leaving strings may be not
translated, for example, ':' in English is different 'ï¼' in Chinese.

Change-Id: I00e690021c44f1debbe034cc0837a07b292ffd1b
Closes-Bug: #1220813

this wait_for method seems to be only used in one single place (test_get_console_output) across all tempest cases

still I think you should LOG.debug rather than LOG.info"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 11:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 11:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Giulio: I was copying the existing style from above when using LOG.info, but looking more at it, I think it should actually be LOG.error since LOG.exception below will log with the ERROR level as well.

I think this is important enough to log at the ERROR level. In my test run I had wait_for running the condition in a loop for 40 minutes without showing any error.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-22 12:00:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ionut, as far as I can understand, the expectations for the wait_for are that the while loop is repeated until no exception is raised; why shall LOG the exception then or LOG.error ?"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 12:17:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

There is no sense in logging in debug mode, since tempest is only aimed at developers in the first place. We should raise/log all exceptions as explicitly as possible instead of hiding them. See also: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#exception-handling

Currently, the while loop is repeated until the timeout is reached; the exception doesn't fix itself after 100+ retries. That can be up to 40 minutes and there is nothing logged in the meantime, except the requests."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-22 12:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Currently, the while loop is repeated until the timeout is reached.

I think that is exactly what the wait_for method is supposed to do, it expects a "condition" as argument.

To me, logging the iterations (rather than just pass) looks like a nice change but seems useful only when in debug mode or so and I don't see the reason to log the exception itself, with every iteration.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-30 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-30 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-07-12 16:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

Thanks for the new panel. I made a few comments inline, and would like to ask other questions as well.

The panel's information is very difficult to read at the moment. I understand it probably wouldn't scale to transform each resource, tenant, etc. into their display name but it's difficult to understand the tables and graphs currently, what they relate to.

I'm trying to understand the use cases and when such a view would be useful. The blueprint suggests only showing the "top consumers", which makes sense to me. As far as I can tell though, this isn't implemented in the current patch? I think it's necessary both to make the information we're showing useful, and to avoid scaling issues.

I think there should also be a (separate) blueprint to have a metering panel at the Project level.'}, {'account_id': 1952, 'date': '2013-07-14 10:54:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Put tables on the panel to the overview page maybe a good idea, since that's what the blueprint says."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-07-15 10:41:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

To recap the IRC discussion:

Personally, I think for now we should improve the readability/usefulness of the current panel, figure out how we want to use it. It would be good to also engage our UX community [0] on this and get their suggestions. Once this is done it should become easier to see how/what could be done to the overview page (we can't just move everything there). I'm wary of adding too much to it, as it's the first page being loaded after login in (so it shouldn't be too slow, nor overloaded with data that a user may not anyway be interested in seeing at this point).

[0] https://plus.google.com/communities/100954512393463248122"}, {'account_id': 1952, 'date': '2013-07-16 03:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks Julie, I am working on it. :)'}, {'account_id': 1952, 'date': '2013-07-16 17:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 18:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

My bad, I didn't see that d3.js is already included into horizon!"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-08-15 14:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I realise the UX discussion is still on-going, however this needs a rebase both because of horizon and ceilometer client changes. With a recent ceilometer client the metering panel returns an error 500 with "'str' object is not callable" (due to commit 1772adf0cc it appears). I wonder if this may be a bug on the ceilometer client part, since clients are usually expected to be backwards compatible.'}, {'account_id': 7585, 'date': '2013-08-16 14:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

There are a few nits that should be fixed.

In other comments, I've suggested some possibilities, that should be probably done as a followup patches for this blueprint.

Also this needs rebase due to pep8 commits.

I also see the error 500 with "'str' object is not callable", jpich pointed out. I will try to look into this some more.

Thank you for the patches, it's very needed feature and you are doing very good job so far.'}, {'account_id': 7585, 'date': '2013-08-16 15:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

Found the aggregates query in the API, you are just missing one parameter in you statistics_list, commented inline'}, {'account_id': 7585, 'date': '2013-08-19 11:32:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

the 'str' 500 bug is on ceilometerclient

ok so forget the previous, the change in ceilometerclient is needed and with no backwards compatibility.

the 'str' 500 bug is on ceilometerclient

commit_message:
Add metering panel to admin console

Now it has usage tables for disk usage,
network traffic usage, network(neutron) usage,
objectstore usage, all agregates of project.

A multiseries linechart with choosable meters, group by, value and time
span.

TODO
Tests fully implemented over all resource usage tabs.

Implements: blueprint admin-resource-usage-page
Change-Id: I9e6c2d25c2587a7642271e43109bc67e2ea1726f
