[{'created': '2013-08-02 19:43:31.000000000', 'message': 'Split NovaObject into 2 base classes

Creates a new NovaDBObject base class for DB-backed objects to use.
NovaObject becomes a base class to use for non-DB-backed objects.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Iaf2d8500505e9acdbffffb1d4bd3db0870ae82a3
'}, {'created': '2013-08-03 08:44:53.000000000', 'message': 'Create mixin class for common DB fields

Creates a new DBObjectMixin class for DB-backed objects to use.  This
allows us to create non-DB-backed objects without having the common DB
fields automagically added to them.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Iaf2d8500505e9acdbffffb1d4bd3db0870ae82a3

commit_message:
Create mixin class for common DB fields

Creates a new DBObjectMixin class for DB-backed objects to use.  This
allows us to create non-DB-backed objects without having the common DB
fields automagically added to them.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Iaf2d8500505e9acdbffffb1d4bd3db0870ae82a3

Begin exposing a Connection class.

far it does absolutely nothing of interest.

commit_message:
Allow default network and policy profiles

Allow for default network/policy profile to be used if
no network/policy profile is specified during network/port creation
in the Cisco N1KV plugin.

Change-Id: I6120abb5abb9a869eb7310453cf27dd8f72bfd1d
Closes-Bug: #1218588

subject: basic async poc
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 4463, 'name': 'iccha-sethi', 'email': 'iccha.sethi@rackspace.com', 'username': 'iccha-sethi'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6493, 'name': 'John Bresnahan', 'email': 'john@bresnahan.me', 'username': 'jbresnah'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-06-06 13:41:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

I added some comments that will help me understand better the idea and hopefully will help us to come up with improvements.

The idea looks good overall, I like the domain abstraction of it and how it fits into glance. However, I don't like the Task and TaskRunner classes. I still feel that we'll be reinventing the wheel there. Instead, we could use Oslo's messaging library, which provides blocking and async executors, as well as a Task / Target oriented model.

TBH, I don't see any real difference between the way we'll manage tasks and the way a task queue works, actually, I do think we should keep a queue in order to preserve order and perhaps handle priorities (thinking in future implementations / ideas here).

Also, there are a couple of other things that we'll have to consider - max concurrency, for example - and this is / will be already implemented in Oslo's messaging lib.

The downside I see is that it's - still - a bit tight to RPC concepts but, if this is something we can do and contribute to, I don't see why we shouldn't.

Hope the above makes sense. 
Way to go Mark, can't wait to see this working!"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-06 14:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-06 14:56:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is still just a draft, but I wanted to share it more broadly.

No changes from patch 1'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-06 15:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for your review and encouragement, Flavio!

Can you provide a few quick links to where the Task and TaskRunner -like components are in oslo?

Does it make it any better to "reinvent the wheel" with those classes if I point out that this branch would eventually be serializing deserializing Task objects to and from the glance database?

Thanks again!'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-06-16 23:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hey Mark, this is good stuff. How will the runner communicate back to update the status?'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-19 18:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

This is actually just a POC for sharing code ideas.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-09-05 22:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Probably not as relevant any more since there is a lot of real work ready to land soon.'}]

commit_message:
Remove quota fetch race condition

When displaying quotas, we shouldn't pull the latest resources
just to convert the results to the dict.

Closes-Bug: #1220436

Change-Id: Id01a310481353b272e103643d053957b65cd4ce3

[{'created': '2013-08-22 22:08:51.000000000', 'message': 'emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p

it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to remind user.

Bug #1215396

commit_message:
emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p

it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to stderr to remind user.

Bug #1215396

Change-Id: Iac6be532b7b9bb911b745712712d1be363e8ff01

commit_message:
xenapi: Add efficient impl of instance_exists()

Override the base class implementation of instance_exists
for efficiency.  This saves a lot of calls to XenAPI.

Change-Id: I07d2f136a12c08cbbc24bf3a3cf72235aed1b232

commit_message:
Fix wrong migrations

For Postgres migrations are failed.
More then we can get for mysql an error
"Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes" in b6ae66d05e3
migration in some versions of dialect.

Fixes-Bug: #1219776

(cherry picked from commit aae3f55304ff161b401b803769350e9cb66b0e8c)

Change-Id: Ia53a8518defd386a8531f62a3a3d19f5fbafbdc4

commit_message:
nova_notifier: fix tests

The prototype for instance_update_and_get_original changed, so let's
ignore it completely for the future.

Fixes-Bug: #1221173
(cherry picked from commit d2a87a9dfd3cd9ef034eed3d693683972c842576)

Change-Id: I060926aa300dc34bd6f592824ebfd2fa9d761268

commit_message:
Add optional host to ceilometer.conf

By default cfg.CONF.host is the `hostname` of local node, however, not all envs
register their hosts by the fqdn.  This allows a configurable attr to add to
the ceilometer.conf

Change-Id: If80cd5264a02eeb7c94655716839642dd7993906

subject: Changes template header for translation catalogs
messages:
[{'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2013-09-05 18:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2013-09-05 18:24:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Babel currently does not rewrite the headers for translation catalogs even if the header in the template changes.  I submitted a pull-request for Babel here: https://github.com/mitsuhiko/babel/pull/54.

This means that in order to change the existing language catalogs we'd have to manually update them.  That's why I have a Patch Set 2 :-)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-05 18:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Changes template header for translation catalogs

New translation catalogs will be generated with the organization set to
'OpenStack Foundation' in the header.

Change-Id: I0da323113030c6a68b3c4bbdd94053639312c594
Partial-Bug: #1214176

@Armando
Thanks for your advice, I prefer an automatic rule too. But how should I do this, doing something in tox.ini or HACKING.rst? Is there some example patches I could learn about.'}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2013-09-05 15:01:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

i think hacking should support this check in future, but now we'd better fix it since this is not a wishlist bug"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-09-05 15:02:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's worthwhile checking if someone else is already working on it. AFAIK Neutron does not have that yet. Look at nova for details:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/tox.ini"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-09-05 15:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Rating this bug as medium seems rather exaggerated taking into account what's going with the gate today. The only reason I marked this with -1 is because people then tend to *forget* to do the right thing, once the quick fix is in place. These errors are not going away...you might as well deal with it radically. That said, that's my opinion, if I am overruled I won't take it personally :)"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-09-05 15:14:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I like doing the right things rather than quick fix. commit_message:
fix conversion type missing

Conversion type is missing in some places which would cause some
unexcepted error. By using 'grep -rn "%(\w\+)\W"', we could find
all cases of '%(variable_a)' and fix them.

Change-Id: I05cbaac73976c70be8428bf5a2d0017ea7059cb3
Closes-Bug: #1221036

commit_message:
Fix typo in IMAGE_META_HEADERS

x-image-meta-deleted-at replaced with x-image-meta-deleted_at
This prevents a problem when running the add_image method.

The bug was entered as part of the following commit:
c3e58bd943ccb4e1457914c3c2b5366bd0afee5a

Closes-Bug:#1220067
Change-Id: I6d1624a00e89721f5c9af969e191951fdcb2ee43

commit_message:
Fixed serialization for role lists

Previously container elements `roles` was not inserted around list of `role` tags.

Change-Id: Icef7f9c161c1e02077a8a031d814e41defea2ee6
Fixes: bug #1065233

It was noted that an update notification should be sent
regardless; this patch addresses that. Since there is
no longer the need to distinguish on whether to send

commit_message:
Fix NVP plugin to send notifications for gateway-less subnets

It was noted that an update notification should be sent
regardless; this patch addresses that. Since there is
no longer the need to distinguish on whether to send
the RPC message or not, the operation has been factored
out to avoid code duplication.

Closes-Bug: 1220881

Change-Id: If553a84b7221f8c98d758654d317217a909c43dc

commit_message:
Pep8 final two unit test modules and enforce (12 of 12)

We also fix up any other pep8 failures that snuck in from merges along
the way.

Change-Id: I4ea984780ac2eac458c98fe181684eef4e04beaf
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Port "Make flavors is_public option .." to v3 tree

The following commit(I5b37fa0bb19683fe1642fd81222547d4a317054e) have
not been merged to v3 tree now, because the commit was merged to the
existing api after porting flavors.py to v3 tree.

    commit b65d506a5f9d9b2b20777a9aceb44a8ffed6a5de
    Author: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
    Date:   Thu Jun 27 21:00:05 2013 +0000

        Make flavors is_public option actually work

This patch ports the commit to v3 tree.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I3c7f11c53594118456d0cd62eb1ddf74634b77c3

commit_message:
Use pattern -> action translators

Instead of having an action map allow for engines to instead
just use a provided translator class to do the pattern to
action translation. This makes actions require less logic to
themselves recursively go over given patterns. Also introduces
the concept of compilation which activates this translation.

- Also includes a drive by commit for a lock around running so
  that 2 users can not run the same engine at the same time.

Change-Id: I95e3c6000beef33002e45716d708551f1b8baa70

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 19:49:09.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid exposing the failures

Failures are an internal list held by the action engine
and likely should not be exposed. Also if an engine is ran
twice then the failures should be reset so that previous
failures are not rethrown.

Change-Id: I6a87f5259d22760a4e6d64a7ea121c840c6cad78
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid exposing the failures

Failures are an internal list held by the action engine
and likely should not be exposed. Also if an engine is ran
twice then the failures should be reset so that previous
failures are not rethrown.

Change-Id: I6a87f5259d22760a4e6d64a7ea121c840c6cad78

commit_message:
Allow reverting to be a normal flow

Instead of always requiring reverting to be different
and requiring reverting to use only a rollback accumulator
it is nicer if reverting can just be another type of flow
that is created by the active flow.

This creates the ability to make reverting just
a normal flow, allowing it to be customized to the
flow developers desires.

Change-Id: I3247a1c8815ff0de8fb95e853b042e691278b80f

should also rename the runners __call__ -> execute.

commit_message:
feat(storage): configurable default paging size

This change add the following options to the config file:

    [limits:storage]
    default_queue_paging = 10
    default_message_paging = 10

So that the default value of the  "limit" URI param is now configurable.

This patch also removes the "actions" cruft.

Implements: blueprint configurable-default-paging
Change-Id: Id38295f1e607226a4259be7744e6ce2d7b6de12e

commit_message:
Drop Cheetah global requirement

Nova was the last project depending on it but moved to Jinja2.

Change-Id: I50e69323dcbc42843778f49f62b8c8b5ffee1331

commit_message:
Added support for running the tests under PyPy with tox

This is a precursor to having them run under check and gate.

Change-Id: I42ed34362bb840fe3a6d1d22e28beba8963fdb85

commit_message:
ensure unique id and timestamp defaults

ceilometer CADF_EVENT.id and CADF_EVENT.eventTime always default
to the same id and timestamp.
fix other bad default values in __init__()

Change-Id: Icd90e96264725ee274893bbd25f4b25cdb830598
Fixes: Bug #1221379

commit_message:
Publish recent api changes as v2.2

Throughout the Havana development cycle, we have added several
features to the v2 api, without breaking backwards compatibility.
So this change bumps up our minor version number.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-03 10:19:53.000000000', 'message': 'Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71     self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1220147

Change-Id: Ide99a836cd601453624c7a562b7256c86bd46811
'}]
commit_message:
Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71     self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1220147

Change-Id: Ide99a836cd601453624c7a562b7256c86bd46811

Adds a conditional step for those users to check the settings.

Closes-bug: 1218665

commit_message:
Fix naming inconsistency for db password databag

The other openstack services cookbooks refer to the db password databag by the
service name (nova, swift, quantum) and therefore openstack-metering cookbook
should call the db password databag by service name 'ceilometer' to make it
consistent

Change-Id: I0a17e065f630f8506a5dd94b3a1ff8ed44482adc

[{'created': '2013-08-29 17:02:58.000000000', 'message': "Inline a custom file_line provider to fix agent.

Fixes an issue in the ceilometer::agent::compute manifest
where nova.conf config values for the notification_driver
would get added to the wrong section (always to the end of
the file).

As part of the fix a custom file_line 'after' provider which
supports a new after option has been added.
This allows us to have some control over which section *new*
file lines go into. If there are any pre-existing matching
lines in the file the assumption is that they are already in
the correct section and can be edited in place.

NOTE: I've submitted a pull request to the upstream stdlib repo here
to add the new 'after' option:

  https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-stdlib/pull/174

Once this (or something better) lands in stdlib we can update
puppet-ceilometer to use it.

Fixes LP Bug #1217867

Change-Id: Ic09f5232b322cde687d663d1ef38ef0fd12f32ff

commit_message:
Inline a custom file_line provider to fix agent.

Fixes an issue in the ceilometer::agent::compute manifest
where nova.conf config values for the notification_driver
would get added to the wrong section (always to the end of
the file).

As part of the fix a custom file_line 'after' provider which
supports a new after option has been added.
This allows us to have some control over which section *new*
file lines go into. If there are any pre-existing matching
lines in the file the assumption is that they are already in
the correct section and can be edited in place.

NOTE: I've submitted a pull request to the upstream stdlib repo here
to add the new 'after' option:

  https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-stdlib/pull/174

Once this (or something better) lands in stdlib we can update
puppet-ceilometer to use it.

Fixes LP Bug #1217867

Change-Id: Ic09f5232b322cde687d663d1ef38ef0fd12f32ff

commit_message:
Call safe_encode() instead of str()

To avoid the error in python2.6:
"UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters",
use safe_encode() to encode basestring instead of str().

Fix bug #1218719

Change-Id: Id26f23ad7f975a3a50750927adbedb86bf80871d

commit_message:
Use 192.0.2.1 for seed endpoint

devtest uses 192.0.2.1 we should too, also moving the route add for
192.0.2.0/24 so it happens before we try to use the endpoints.

Change-Id: I6974617d43eb273eadf893e8d2facda1b1092904

I appreciate all reviews and comments.

Dear Brant
I am sorry for forgetting fix to assertEqual().
I fixed it now.

Dear Morgan
I would like to propose that the documentation about UTC time is deprecated.

I also checked auth_token with memcached, but it works with timzeone.

I prepared for two servers.
One is keystone development server with this patch, another is swift with auth_token.
Keystone server runs with JST(UTC+9) and swift server runs with PDT(UTC-7) and memcached run in both server.
I use the memcached on swift for token backend and memcached on keystone for auth_token. So Memcached and Keystone components work with different timezone.
I checked token expiration behavior and it worked well.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 04:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 09:28:11.000000000', 'message': 'Support timezone in memcached token backend.

In keystone configuration manual, UTC timezone is required when
operators use memcached token backend.
It is inconvenient for operators.

By this patch, memcached token backend works well without UTC.

I guess the cause is incorrect time is set as expiration.

backends/memcache.py uses utils.unixtime() and it calls
time.mktime().
But mktime() returns local time, not UTC time.

This patch replaces time.mktime() with calendar.timegm().

utils.unixtime() is only called by memcache.py and
test_backend_memcache.py.
There is no impact to other codes.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configuration.html

Change-Id: I17233c8a79d01a37abdbd46934ad486ddc8caec9

commit_message:
Support timezone in memcached token backend

This patch fixes bug #1221087.

Replaces time.mktime() to calendar.timegm() in utils.unixtime()
to get correct expiration time.

After this patch, Memcached token backend does not depend on timezone.
So remove the section "Memcached and System Time" in configuration manual.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I17233c8a79d01a37abdbd46934ad486ddc8caec9

Since we are no longer supporting templates in ironic
then we can simply remove this option altogether

Change-Id: I94e8c2d8fec70175e294f9b67156f13cd11ee642
'}]
commit_message:
Removed  templates directory in api config

This patch removes the template_path config
option in the API config file.  The path currently
points to a non existing directory.

Since we are no longer supporting templates in ironic
then we can simply remove this option altogether

Change-Id: I94e8c2d8fec70175e294f9b67156f13cd11ee642

commit_message:
Handle port over-quota when allocating network for instance

This patch adds a check in the neutron API for a port create failure due
to over-quota in neutron and raises the new exception PortLimitExceeded.

Also moves the port-create block of code into it's own method to
try and clean up some of the large allocate_for_instance method.

Closes-Bug: #1207914
Related-Bug: #1209446

Change-Id: I4000c8ab550e032363f138a86e1b87f6ab2f5ff2

commit_message:
Clean-ups related to alarm history patches

Some non-blocking clean-ups requested in reviews of the alarm
history patches.

Change-Id: If009166be450f2e1bba0e68ce74699b5a032543e

commit_message:
Add sub-type field to VXLAN network profiles for Cisco N1KV plugin

Rename VXLAN type of network profiles to Overlay network profiles.
Add a new sub type column to Overlay network profiles. Support
enhanced VXLAN and native VXLAN as Overlay sub types. Allow plugin to
be flexible to support newer sub types.

Change-Id: I3899b01f316902d1139e47b153a9db7ecb3ff982
Implements: blueprint cisco-plugin-n1k-enh-vxlan-support

Code looks good.
I have tested with this devstack and it works.

I have a question about the spec but it can be addressed in future work.

We are allowing to specify ip address directory.
But it may break the ipam model in neutron.
Because neutron wanna know the all ips for ip allocation.

so when a user specifies a IP 10.0.0.100 on allowed address pair, 
the ip may be allocatable for another port.

I could think two workaround.

1) Remove the ip from ipallocation pool, if the ip is in the allocation pool
2) allocate port if the ip is specified. ( if we choose this, may be we should take port_id in  Allowed Address Pairs.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-30 06:33:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Implement Allowed Address Pairs

The following patch adds the concept of allowed address pairs.
This allows one to add additional ip/mac address pairs on a port to
allow traffic that matches those specified values. This is useful in order
to leverage dataplane failover mechanisms like vrrp. This patch adds support
for the NVP plugin, the OVS plugin, and Ml2.

DocImpact

implements blueprint: allowed-address-pairs

Change-Id: Ie73b3886c5be8e1fc4ade86a0cfb854267f345ac

commit_message:
Switch Ceilometer default backend to MySQL

MongoDB 2.4 not being available in Ubuntu cloud archive for a while now,
and the catch up done by this driver allows me to think it might be a
good idea to switch by default on SQL for now on devstack.

We can add another job to have Ceilometer tested on MongoDB too later.

Change-Id: I74c3c436d009fed898c5ae4ffb82763e9a337d90

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-17 15:06:42.000000000', 'message': "Enable libvirt driver to use the new BDM format

This patch makes the necessary changes in the libvirt driver to enable
it to use some of the features of the new block device mapping format.

After this patch it will be possible to set the bus, and device_type per
block device, and libvirt driver will honor these when spawning an
instance (note that attaching a volume still does not use the new data
format).

It utilizes some of the existing code in the blockinfo module to be able
to default device names (it does so by overriding the methods introduced
in I84541f8ff6e1b5978734e5def69946d014c66fdf), and also assign default
values to fields like device_type and disk_bus if it is not provided or
if it is bogus.

It also modifies some of the code paths in the libvirt driver that use
the block device info directly (and not through the blockinfo module) to
be aware of the new format. Due to very nicely factored code - there
were only a few instances of this in the driver itself.

It also overrides the libvirt driver's need_legacy_block_device_info
method to tell the compute manager to feed it the new format when
needed.

This patch concludes the blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I8efd6af6706a097fb540e040a86ccbeaf131631f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-17 15:15:16.000000000', 'message': "Enable libvirt driver to use the new BDM format

This patch makes the necessary changes in the libvirt driver to enable
it to use some of the features of the new block device mapping format.

After this patch it will be possible to set the bus, and device_type per
block device, and libvirt driver will honor these when spawning an
instance (note that attaching a volume still does not use the new data
format).

It utilizes some of the existing code in the blockinfo module to be able
to default device names (it does so by overriding the methods introduced
in I84541f8ff6e1b5978734e5def69946d014c66fdf), and also assign default
values to fields like device_type and disk_bus if it is not provided or
if it is bogus. As this implies the driver changing the block devices in
the database, a new virtapi method block_device_mapping_update is added
to accommodate this.

It also modifies some of the code paths in the libvirt driver that use
the block device info directly (and not through the blockinfo module) to
be aware of the new format. Due to very nicely factored code - there
were only a few instances of this in the driver itself.

It also overrides the libvirt driver's need_legacy_block_device_info
method to tell the compute manager to feed it the new format when
needed.

This patch concludes the blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I8efd6af6706a097fb540e040a86ccbeaf131631f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 08:05:11.000000000', 'message': "Enable libvirt driver to use the new BDM format

This patch makes the necessary changes in the libvirt driver to enable
it to use some of the features of the new block device mapping format.

After this patch it will be possible to set the bus, and device_type per
block device, and libvirt driver will honor these when spawning an
instance (note that attaching a volume still does not use the new data
format).

It utilizes some of the existing code in the blockinfo module to be able
to default device names (it does so by overriding the methods introduced
in I84541f8ff6e1b5978734e5def69946d014c66fdf), and also assign default
values to fields like device_type and disk_bus if it is not provided or
if it is bogus. As this implies the driver changing the block devices in
the database, a new virtapi method block_device_mapping_update is added
to accommodate this.

It also modifies some of the code paths in the libvirt driver that use
the block device info directly (and not through the blockinfo module) to
be aware of the new format. Due to very nicely factored code - there
were only a few instances of this in the driver itself.

It also overrides the libvirt driver's need_legacy_block_device_info
method to tell the compute manager to feed it the new format when
needed.

Adds mock to test-requirements - it is already present in the
requirements project.

This patch concludes the blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I8efd6af6706a097fb540e040a86ccbeaf131631f

commit_message:
Enable libvirt driver to use the new BDM format

This patch makes the necessary changes in the libvirt driver to enable
it to use some of the features of the new block device mapping format.

After this patch it will be possible to set the bus, and device_type per
block device, and libvirt driver will honor these when spawning an
instance (note that attaching a volume still does not use the new data
format).

It utilizes some of the existing code in the blockinfo module to be able
to default device names (it does so by overriding the methods introduced
in I84541f8ff6e1b5978734e5def69946d014c66fdf), and also assign default
values to fields like device_type and disk_bus if it is not provided or
if it is bogus. As this implies the driver changing the block devices in
the database, a new virtapi method block_device_mapping_update is added
to accommodate this. Some of the libvirt specific code paths in the
general defaulting function in compute utils have been removed as they
are not needed since the driver now takes care of this.

Further to that, this patch modifies some of the code paths in the
libvirt driver that use the block device info directly (and not through
the blockinfo module) to be aware of the new format. Due to very nicely
factored code - there were only a few instances of this in the driver
itself.

It also overrides the libvirt driver's need_legacy_block_device_info
method to tell the compute manager to feed it the new format when
needed.

This patch concludes the blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I8efd6af6706a097fb540e040a86ccbeaf131631f

General comment about tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py: in those methods where you are taking **kwargs, please add comments to indicate the allowed keys / values, as specified by the API: 

http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-network/2.0/content/index.html

The overall intent of my comments in tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py is that with very little additional effort you will produce a much fuller implementation of the API."}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-08-17 08:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

minsel - re: the conversion of everything to kwargs - I think it depends on what is the common case. If most of the time only the named argument is required then I think its fine to leave it as a separate argument because it makes writing tests easier and clearer.

Definitely agree with the need to add documentation if accepting kwargs however. Especially if everything is just being passed blindly on in the body.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2013-08-17 15:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

Christopher Yeoh, thank you for your observation. The larger point I was trying to make is that since Nayna is already accepting a kwargs argument in most cases, with very little additional effort we can cover a lot more of the Neutron API with this client (which we need a lot) if we move everything to kwargs. Your points about the common case, ease of coding and clarity are very valid, though. These two considerations are not mutually exclusive. We can achieve both. Using the create_floating_ip as an example, it could be redefined as:

def create_floating_ip(self, ext_network_id, port_id, **kwargs):

which reflects the common case. The request body could be created as follows:

post_body = {'floatingip': kwargs}
post_body = ['floatingip']['floating_network_id'] = ext_network_id
post_body = ['floatingip']['port_id'] = port_id

This way we enable a future test to call the method with 'fixed_ip_address' and / or 'floating_ip_address' in kwargs without much effort and now we completely implemented the API specification for this operation.

The observation about commenting what can be passed in kwargs is still very important

I'll put a pointer to this exchange in the in-line comments I made last night, to make sure Nayna takes it into consideration"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2013-08-17 15:35:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Added test case to check floating IP API operations

Added a test case by the name
'test_create_list_show_update_delete_floating_ip' to check
floating IP API operations. Also added supporting methods
in network_client.py

Implements blueprint: quantum-test-l2-abstraction

Change-Id: I13ca20a249e9eba0a52e6eb3c6e82baaa38fc5a0

'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-22 09:53:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

hi there, to be honest I think the existing code is working pretty well because the console could just be '\n' depending on the image launched (not being a failure then)

instead there could be other edge cases where we should probably report failure but how about you put that in a list and use assertNotIn ?"}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2013-08-22 09:58:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Please see my comment."}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 09:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Giulio: What kind of image would just return "/n"?

If the output is "\n" then this line will raise an error:

self.assertEqual(lines, 10)'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 09:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 10:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-22 10:20:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

hi Ionut, I said '\n' not '/n' and as you suggest in the commit message, that would raise an assertionerror so I think the existing code is working well

as per my inline comment, to cover more falsy results I think the best approach here would be to use assertNotIn and put in a tuple/list the unwanted outputs"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-08-22 11:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Giulio, I made a typo in my comment. I meant "\n" both times. Still, like I said, output == "\n" will raise an error later on.

I'm asserting that bool(output) is True, which means it is not any of the false values of python: None, {}, "". Putting those in a list would be redundant.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-22 11:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ionut I see, thanks for clarifying that.

If the unwanted cases are just the default non-null python, then this makes sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-23 07:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
raise assertion error if output is falsy

No error was being raised when output was {}, but the following line
"output.split('\n')" raised an AssertionError.

Change-Id: I37d27f8b890941d9333e71c64b1af6127505d766

[{'created': '2013-09-05 12:59:27.000000000', 'message': 'Make tox use develop instead of sdist

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of the
feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to install the
code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from run_tests.sh - so the
performance issues around using tox vs. using install_venv should now be
gone.

This patch requires tox >=1.6.

Change-Id: I505fb530e8047f478e98ce2fd6c01776b147d87f
'}, {'created': '2013-09-05 15:12:21.000000000', 'message': 'Make tox use develop instead of sdist

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of the
feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to install the
code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from run_tests.sh - so the
performance issues around using tox vs. using install_venv should now be

Change-Id: I505fb530e8047f478e98ce2fd6c01776b147d87f

commit_message:
Make tox use develop instead of sdist

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of the
feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to install the
code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from run_tests.sh - so the
performance issues around using tox vs. using install_venv should now be
gone.

This patch requires tox >=1.6.

Change-Id: I505fb530e8047f478e98ce2fd6c01776b147d87f

commit_message:
Add a method to retrieve job binary data from a JobOrigin record

This change adds a job_origin.py module to savanna/service/edp.  The
module contains a method to retrieve job binary data from a JobOrigin
record based on the storage type and url in the JobOrigin.  The REST
api also contains a method to retrieve job binary data based on a
JobOrigin id.

Change-Id: I3bd446508172e37ed2d1c5a22e311d5d2510570d

commit_message:
Adds includedir back to templates

This adds includedir to the mysql templates, which allows overriding of
default my.cnf settings. Additionally, /etc/mysql/conf.d is created if it
doesn't already exist to prevent mysql from failing.

Change-Id: I1e051978b2363eaa9fd11abf1b107bd1e9c0edcb
Fixes: bug #1218613

[{'created': '2013-09-04 19:22:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix tuple usage error

The exc_info is just a tuple (captured in taskflow)
and isn't itself a callable object so we should not
need to use it like one to extract the exception type
and value.

Fixes bug #1220867

Change-Id: Ie27d004bad4053baa2ac8eb84bb8b7cdc05a954d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tuple usage error

The exc_info is just a tuple (captured in taskflow)
and isn't itself a callable object so we should not
need to use it like one to extract the exception type
and value.

Fixes bug #1220867

Change-Id: Ie27d004bad4053baa2ac8eb84bb8b7cdc05a954d

Honestly I don't even understand what all this code is trying to accomplish. Furthermore, it seems very bloated and unclean. 

It is also not clear to me what the nova scheduler will do with the values you extracted/computed, and I have a feeling it may not make sense, but I can't say for sure because I couldn't find any comments about what you are modelling and what will be done with that info.

(7 inline comments)

I kinda thought we all agreed that we were going to try to avoid adding more instances where one compute proxies for some large number of hosts behind it? This is a single point of failure for the control plane right?

I didn't review all the files, but found enough issues for one round."}, {'account_id': 7239, 'date': '2013-06-10 14:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Dan: This was discussed in the openstack-dev mailing list and on IRC. Agree that it can be a single point of failure. This approach gives a choice to the admin. Without this option the admin has to have a VM/server with nova-compute service running for each cluster to be managed. Eventually there will be some architectural changes (http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-May/008804.html) that will allow other management software like vCenter to integrate with Openstack in a better way. In the interim, this is the solution.

Your review comments will be addressed in the next patchset. 
Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 7239, 'date': '2013-06-11 10:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-11 11:39:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-08-24 08:00:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'created': '2013-08-14 13:42:10.000000000', 'message': 'Multiple Clusters using single compute service

To allow a single VC driver to model multiple Clusters in vCenter
as multiple nova-compute nodes.
To allow the VC driver to be configured to represent a set of
clusters as compute nodes. For example to specify two clusters
named cluster-A and cluster-B, the nova.conf should have
cluster_name=cluster-A
cluster_name=cluster-B

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia5464948cc30b9b744450f9c301c4f3afaff717b

commit_message:
VMware: Multiple cluster support using single compute service

To allow a single VC driver to model multiple clusters in vCenter
as multiple nova-compute nodes. The VC driver will be configured
to represent a set of clusters as compute nodes.
For example to specify two clusters named cluster-A and cluster-B,
the nova.conf should have:
    cluster_name = cluster-A
    cluster_name = cluster-B

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia5464948cc30b9b744450f9c301c4f3afaff717b
Blueprint: multiple-clusters-managed-by-one-service
